In contrast to black tea, fermantation is intentionaly avoided during the production of green tea.  The natural contituents and also the greenish yellow color are largely preserved in this manner. 40;Coffee: Mehmet Efendi Turkish Coffee - 17.64 oz. (Kahve:  Mehmet Efendi Kahve - 500 gr.);Excellent Turkish Ground Coffee from Mehmet Efendi (Mehmet Efendi'den mukemmel bir kahve)<p>The Recipe for Turkish Coffee: Turkish Coffe traditionally prepared in a small long handled pot (Cezve).  For medium-sweet cofee, add one small spoonful of sugar per cup.  Place Cezve on a low heat with one heaped T-Spoon Turkish Cofee per cupfull of water and sugar to taste. Heat slowly, stirring gently until the sugar dissolves. When the coffee begins to froth up, remove fom the heat, pour a little of the froth into each cup and return to the heat.  Let the coffee rise one more- without letting it come to boil- and serve.  Enjoy.<p>Turkish coffee is made of finely pulverized roasted coffee beans. Roasting degree and duration differ according to taste. Coffee is sold either green, or roasted beans or in pulverized form in small shops called " Kuru Yemisçi " which means a person who sells all kinds of nuts, dried fruits, candy bars, bon-bons, coffee varieties, alcoholic drinks and miscellaneous. In old houses a brass-made hand manupulated coffee mill would be used to pulverize coffee beans. An electrical coffee mill is used instead of brass-coffee mill at present time in many households. Turkish coffee is prepared in 4 ways. <p>"Az Sekerli" means coffee has little sugar about 1/2 teaspoon.<p> "Orta Sekerli" means coffee has standart amount of sugar 1 teaspoon. <p>"Çok Sekerli" means coffee has more sugar than enough which is 1 1/2 teaspoons. <p>"Sade Kahve" means black coffee, without sugar. <p>Turkish coffee is served in demitasses made of porcelain. They come in different sizes.However an average demitasse is equal to 1/4 cup in volume. Coffee is served for guest with bon-bon, candy bar or with " Lokum " (Turkish Delight) or with chocolate bars. It is served usually during midday or following a lunch or dinner. There is an old saying about coffee which goes like this. " Bir kahve fincanin kirk yil hatiri vardir " meaning that if one has offered a demitasse of coffee he is obliged for forty years to the one who offered the coffee. It means that the person who offers the coffee is to be respected, honoured, and remembered for a long time for the sake of his coffee offering.<p>(Kahve Recetesi: Icme suyunu fincanla olcerek cezveye koyunuz.  Her fincan icin iki kucuk kasigi kahve, arzunuza gore seker ilave ediniz (orta icin iki kasik).  Kisik ateste kahve ve sekeri iyice karistiriniz.  Bir sure sonra kabaran kopugu fincanlara pay ediniz.  Kalan kahveyi bir tasim daha pisiriniz ve fincanlara bosaltiniz. Afiyet olsun.)<p>Weight: 17.5 oz. (500 grams);At-00040;50;9.69;8.99;images/product/Mehmet Efendi Turkish Coffee Buyuk-T.jpg;images/product/Mehmet Efendi Turkish Coffee -Q.jpg;images/product/Mehmet Efendi Turkish Coffee -Q.jpg;Turkish Coffee (Turk Kahvesi);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Turkish & Other Coffees (Turk ve Diger Kahveler),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;10.00;0;0;0;420,140,423;

140;Coffee: Mehmet Efendi Turkish Coffee - 8.8 oz. (Kahve: Mehmet Efendi Kahve - 250 gr.);Excellent Turkish Ground Coffee from Mehmet Efendi (Mehmet Efendi'den mukemmel bir kahve) <p>The Recipe for Turkish Coffee: Turkish Coffe traditionally prepared in a small long handled pot (Cezve). For medium-sweet cofee, add one T-sponful of sugar per cup. Place Cezve on a low heat with one heaped T-Spoon Turkish Cofee per cupfull of water and sugar to taste. Heat slowly, stirring gently until the sugar dissolves. When the coffee begins to froth up, remove fom the heat, pour a little of the froth into each cup and return to the heat. Let the coffee rise one more- without letting it come to boil- and serve. Enjoy. <p>Turkish coffee is made of finely pulverized roasted coffee beans. Roasting degree and duration differ according to taste. Coffee is sold either green, or roasted beans or in pulverized form in small shops called " Kuru Yemisçi " which means a person who sells all kinds of nuts, dried fruits, candy bars, bon-bons, coffee varieties, alcoholic drinks and miscellaneous. In old houses a brass-made hand manupulated coffee mill would be used to pulverize coffee beans. An electrical coffee mill is used instead of brass-coffee mill at present time in many households. Turkish coffee is prepared in 4 ways. <p>"Az Sekerli" means coffee has little sugar about 1/2 teaspoon.<p> "Orta Sekerli" means coffee has standart amount of sugar 1 teaspoon. <p>"Çok Sekerli" means coffee has more sugar than enough which is 1 1/2 teaspoons. <p>"Sade Kahve" means black coffee, without sugar. <p>Turkish coffee is served in demitasses made of porcelain. They come in different sizes.However an average demitasse is equal to 1/4 cup in volume. Coffee is served for guest with bon-bon, candy bar or with " Lokum " (Turkish Delight) or with chocolate bars. It is served usually during midday or following a lunch or dinner. There is an old saying about coffee which goes like this. " Bir kahve fincanin kirk yil hatiri vardir " meaning that if one has offered a demitasse of coffee he is obliged for forty years to the one who offered the coffee. It means that the person who offers the coffee is to be respected, honoured, and remembered for a long time for the sake of his coffee offering.<p>(Kahve Recetesi: Icme suyunu fincanla olcerek cezveye koyunuz. Her fincan icin iki kucuk kasik kahve, arzunuza gore seker ilave ediniz (orta icin iki kasik). Kisik ateste kahve ve sekeri iyice karistiriniz. Bir sure sonra kabaran kopugu fincanlara pay ediniz. Kalan kahveyi bir tasim daha pisiriniz ve fincanlara bosaltiniz. Afiyet olsun.) <p>Weight: 8.8 oz. 159;Toiletries: Bogazici Lemon Cologne-Plastic-460cc (Banyo Malzemeleri: Bogazici Limon Kolonyasi-Plast;Refreshing Lemon Cologene in a Plastic Bottle (Plastik Sise'de Ferahlatici Limon Kolonyasi)<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Ethil Alcohol, Lemon Fregarance, Di-ionized Water. (Etil Alkol, Limon Esansi, Deiyonize Su.)<p>Info (Bilgi): Perfumes based on alcohol first appeared in Ottoman Turkey during the early years of the reign of Sultan Abdülhamid II (1876-1909). Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life.  The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. You are likely to be offered cologne not only in homes, but on intercity buses, whose passengers are looked upon as guests. When visiting someone who is ill or buying souvenirs for friends during a visit to another part of the country, a bottle of cologne is one of the most acceptable gifts. <p>Weight (Agirlik): 15 fl. oz. (460 cc.);At-00151;50;7.49;6.99;images/product/Bogazici_Kolonya_Cologne-T.jpg;images/product/Bogazici_Kolonya_Cologne-T.jpg;images/product/Bogazici_Limon_Kolonyasi-Z.jpg;Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;8.00;0;0;0;407,161,160;

Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. 161;Toiletries: Goksin Rose Water-400cc (Banyo Malzemeleri: Goksin Gulsuyu-400cc);Uplifting Unique Rosewater Cologne in a Plastic Bottle from Goksin, Izmir. (Goksin, Izmir'den Plastik Sise icinde Ferahlatici Gulsuyu.)<p>There was already a long-standing Ottoman tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. Rose Water (Gul suyu), which is prepared from roses, could be served as as drink or in a dessert such as Gullac. Because its taste is so close to the sweet smell of the actual rose some people find it difficult to drink or even eat in its jam form or with just plain cold milk or water. This is truly a Turkish product to try.<p>Weight (Agirlik) 13 fl. oz. 184;Meat Products: Ohanyans Bastirma-Curried Dried Beef Strip-8 oz. (Et Urunleri: Ohanyans Pastirma);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Beef, Salt, Water, Spices, Garlic, Paprika, Sodium Nitrite, Sodium Erythorbate. (Dana Eti, Tuz, Su, Baharatlar, Sarimsak, Kirmizi Biber, Sodyum Nitrit, Sodyum Erythorbat.)<p>Info (Bilgi): The Turkish horsemen of Central Asia used to preserve meat by placing slabs of it in pockets on the sides of their saddles, where it would be pressed by their legs as they rode. This pressed meat was the forerunner of todays past&#305~rma, a term which literally means being pressed in Turkish, and is the origin of the Italian pastrami.  Past&#305~rma is delicious with fresh crusty bread, grilled lightly over charcoal, fried in butter with eggs or in layered pastry börek. Haricot bean stew with pieces of past&#305~rma is another popular dish in Turkey. Past&#305~rma is a favourite meze with rak&#305~, Turkeys national aniseed drink. If you visit one of the meyhanes (taverns) in Beyo&#287~lu in Istanbul, do not forget to try the delicious paçanga börek made with past&#305~rma.<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri):<p>Calories (Enerji): 120 kcal.<p>Total Fat (Toplam Yag): 3.5 g.<p>Saturated Fat (Doymus Yag): 1.5 g.<p>Cholesterol (Kolesterol): 40 mg.<p>Total Carbohydrate (Toplam Karbonhidrat): 4 g.<p>Dietary Fiber (Lifi): 0 g.<p>Sugars (Sekerler): 0 g.<p> Protein (Protein): 18 g.<p>Weight (Agirlik): 8 oz. Cook this in high heat approximately 5-10 minutes or till the edges are brown. Remove from the heat and let it wait in room temperature for a while and place it to your fridge for a couple of hours. Serve it Cold.(875 ml.-4.5 su bardagi soguk sutu bir tencereye bosaltin. Uzerine posetin tamamini ilave edin. Orta ateste sureli karistirarak pisirin. (Tahin & Pekmez: Koska Pekmez-1.2 kg.);Koska Molasses (Pekmez) is a thick syrup made by boiling down grape juice mode of grapes coming from the Aegean and the Marmara regions.  It is mechanically paked in our plants without manipulation.  The slight crystalization that could occur in the "Pekmez" does not mean that the product has gone bad. It will be sufficient to keep the jar into hot water during a certain time and then stir the "Pekmez" inside jar. 238;Pastas: Kral Baked Meat Manti-8.8 oz. (Makarnalar: Kral Firinlanmis Etli Manti-250 gr.);Ingredients (icindekiler): Wheat Flour, Water, Eggs, Soybean Flour, Salt, Mince Meat, Onions, Black Pepper, Lemon. (Bugday Unu, Su, Yumurta, Tuz, Soya Unu, Kiyma, Kuru Sogan, Karabiber, Limon.)<p>Directions (Hazirlanisi): Boil 2 liters-10 glasses- water with beef bullion.  Add 1 bag of Manti and boil for 20 minutes. Place the Manti ona service plate after draining it. Spread yoghurt either plain or with garlic on top of it.  Pour melted butter or sauce on top of it and add your spices of your choice.  Bon Appetite!  (2 litre-10 bardak et suyu kaynatilir.  Icine poset manti boslatilip~ 20 dakika kadar haslanir.  Haslanmis olan manti suzulerek servis tabagina konulur, uzerine sarimsakli veya sade hazirlanmis yogurt yayilir.  Yogurttan sonra ss ve tereyagi gezdirilir.  Arzuya gore baharat serpistirilerek servise sunulur.  Afiyet Olsun!)<p>Info(Bilgi): Manti is known with the same name in many parts of Anatolia. This is a dish which has originated in the Central Asia and has survived as a very popular dish to this date. It is eaten as a single course at lunch or dinner. In Bolu region yogurt-tomato sauce is replaced with a hard cheese (kes) - walnut sauce. 1/4 cup grinded kes is mixed with 1 cup crushed walnuts and sprinkled over the drained manti with browned butter sprinkled on the top. In some regions it is common that garlic yoghurt is poured over Manti and it is complemented with a red pepper and/or sumac, tomato paste and melted butter mixture.<p> Weight (Agirlik): 8.8 oz. 250;Spices: Baktat Cinnamon-2.82 oz. (Baharatlar: Baktat Tarcin-80gr.);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Cinnamon (Tarcin)<p>Info for this spice: One of the oldest known spices, cinnamon is mentioned in the Bible and in Sanskrit writings. Cinnamon is native to Sri Lanka and comes from the tropical evergreen laurel tree, Cinnamomum zeylanicum.  Ground cinnamon enhances many curries and meat stews especially those made with lamb. It can also be used in cakes, puddings, breads and stewed fruits.  Cinnamon sticks are often used in hot drinks such as mulled wine , hot chocolate and coffee to add just that extra zing on a cold night. (En eski baharatlardan bir tanesi olan Tarcin, Incil'de ve Hint yazilarinda dahi bahsedilmistir. Tarcin'in orijini Sri Lanka olup "Cinnamomum zeylanicum" agicindan gelmektedir.  Ogutulmus Tarcin bircok yemegi ve tatliya tat katar.  Ozellikle salep, kakoa, kahve gibi sicak iceceklerde mukemmeldir.) <p>Weight (Agirlik): 2.82 oz. 253;Spices: Baktat Clove-1.76 oz.  (Baharatlar: Baktat Karanfil-50gr.);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Clove. (Karanfil.)<p>Info for this spice: The clove tree is endemic in Indonesia and was of old cultivated on the islands of Ternate, Tidore, Bacan and the West coast of Halmahera. The Dutch extended cultivation to several other islands, but only after the end of the Dutch monopoly (18.th century), clove trees were introduced to other countries. Today, Zanzibar and Madagascar are the main producers, followed by Indonesia.  Cloves are Strongly aromatic and very intensive fragrance~ fiery and burning taste.  It is impossible to mention all cuisines where cloves are used~ they are much loved by the Chinese, play an important role in Sri Lankan cooking, are extensively used in the Moghul cuisine of Northern India, enjoy high popularity in the Middle East and many Arab countries and are a common spice in Northern Africa. In all these countries, they are preferred for meat dishes~ frequently, rice is aromatized with a few cloves. Europeans seem to dislike their strong flavour and use them mostly for sweets, stewed fruits and bread~ sometimes, rice is boiled together with one or two cloves. In England, cloves are popular in pickles. (Karanfil agaci, Endenozya'ya ozgu bir baharattir ve Ternate, Tidore, Bacan and the Halmahera Bati yakasinda yaygin bulunur. Hollanda, koloni zamanlarinda bu agaci bolgedeki diger adalarada yayginlastirmislardir.  Ancak 18. yuzyildan sonra Hollanda'nin monopolisi bittikten sonra bu diger ulkelere yayginlastirilmistir.  Gunumuzde Zenzibar, Madagaskar ve Endonezya'da yayginca uretilmektedir. Karanfil agir kokulu ve aromatik, vede yakici ve aci tatta bir baharattir. Karanfil'in degisik mutfaklara misafir olmustur.  Hindistan, Orta Dogu ve Kuzey Afrika ulkerlerinde populer olmakla beraber, Avrupa ulkelerinde genelde tatililarda ilgi gormustur.)<p>Weight (Agirlik): 1.76 (50 gram);At-0415;50;3.99;2.99;images/product/Baktat_Karanfil_50gr-T.jpg;images/product/Baktat_Karanfil_50gr-Q.jpg;images/product/Baktat_Karanfil_50gr-Z.jpg;Spices (Baharatlar);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore),Express-Spices (Baharatlar);New;;;;4.00;0;0;0;250,254,258;

281;Pastas: Tatsam Kayseri Home Manti-8.8 oz. (Makarnalar: Tatsam Kayseri Ev Mantisi-250 gr.);Ingredients (icindekiler): Wheat Flour, Water, Eggs, Salt, Calf Mince, Onion, Spices. (Bugday Unu, Su, Yumurta, Tuz, Dana Kiyma, Kuru Sogan, Baharat.) <p>Directions (Hazirlanisi): Boil 3-3.5 glasses of water with beef bullion and a spoon of butter. Add 1 bag of Manti and boil for 10-15 minutes. Place the Manti ona service plate after draining it. Spread yoghurt either plain or with garlic on top of it. Pour melted butter or sauce on top of it and add your spices of your choice. Bon Appetite! (3-3.5 bardak et suyu, bir kasik tereyagi ile kaynatilir. Icine poset manti boslatilip~ 10-15 dakika kadar haslanir. Haslanmis olan manti suzulerek servis tabagina konulur, uzerine sarimsakli veya sade hazirlanmis yogurt yayilir. Yogurttan sonra sos ve tereyagi gezdirilir. Arzuya gore baharat serpistirilerek servise sunulur. Afiyet Olsun!) <p>Info(Bilgi): Manti is known with the same name in many parts of Anatolia. This is a dish which has originated in the Central Asia and has survived as a very popular dish to this date. It is eaten as a single course at lunch or dinner. In Bolu region yogurt-tomato sauce is replaced with a hard cheese (kes) - walnut sauce. 1/4 cup grinded kes is mixed with 1 cup crushed walnuts and sprinkled over the drained manti with browned butter sprinkled on the top. In some regions it is common that garlic yoghurt is poured over Manti and it is complemented with a red pepper and/or sumac, tomato paste and melted butter mixture.<p> Weight (Agirlik): 8.8 oz. 304;Puddings: Dr Oetker Ashure Traditional Legume Pudding (Pudingler: Dr. Oetker A&#351~ure);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Wheat Paste, Dry Fuits- Grape-Orange-Peach, Boiled Grains-Chick Peas-Beans. (Seker, Bugday Ezmesi, Kuru Mueyveler-Uzum-Kus Uzumu- Portakal-Kayisi, On Pisirilmiz Baklagil-Nohut-Fasulye, Pirinc.)<p>Information (Bilgi): It is one of the oldest and most traditional desserts of the Turkish cuisine. 15 or more ingredients go into making "Asure" (pronounced Ashure). It is usually made and served during the religious month called "Asure Month" which follows "The Feast of Sacrifice". All religious days and holidays are observed according to the muslim calendar.  During "Asure Month" the pudding is prepared in large amounts in almost every household, and offered to guests as well as to relatives and neighbors. There is a legend about the origin of this dessert.  "When Noah's Ark came to rest on Mount Ararat in northeastern Turkey, it was felt that a feast of celebration was called for. But their supplies were exhausted. However, they hunted through the Ark and every little bit or food they could find, they put into the pudding and made themselves a splendid feast of Asure. (Asure'nin ilginc bir hikayesi vardir.  Rivayete gore Nuh'un gemisi Agri Daginda karaya oturunca, burda kutlama yapilmasini dusunmusler.  Yiyecek malzemeleri cok az kaldigi icin bolgede bulabildikleri her turlu yiyacegi yaptiklari pudinge katmislar ve guzel bir guzel bir Asure ziyafeti cekmisler.)<p>Preperation (Hazirlanisi):  Pour 750 ml-4 glasses of water to a souppan and add all the contents of packet. Stir until it boils in mild heat. When it starts to boil, lower the heat and boil 20 more minutes without the lid. Once you take it out of the heat, stir occesionally for 5 minutes.  Wait another 5 minutes to decorate with cinnamon, wallnuts, Palmagranite, Pistachio, Sasame, etc. Serve it cold. (750 ml.-3.5 su bardagi suyu bir tencereye bosaltin. Uzerine posetin tamamini ilave edin. Orta ateste sureli karistirarak pisirin. Kaynamaya baslayinca ocagi kisin ve tencere kapagini kapatmadan, 20 dakika daha kaynamaya birakin.  Sonra ocaktan alip arada karistirarak 5 dakika sogutun. Asureyi kepce ile kaselere bosaltin.  5 dakika kadar bekledikten sonra ustunu Tarcin, Nar, Wllnuts, Pistachio, Susam, Cam Fistigi vb. malzemlerle susleyip soguk servis yapin.)<p>Serves 4 (4 kisiliktir.)<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri):<p>Calories (Enerji): 123 kcal.<p>Fat (Yag): 0.20 g.<p>Carbohydrate (Karbonhidrat): 29.40 g.<p>Protein (Protein): 0.90 g.<p>Weight (Agirlik): 7.93 oz. 320;Wine: Kavaklidere Yakut-Red  (Sarap): Kavaklidere Yakut-Kirmizi);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Yakut which is made from Bogazkere and Öküzgözü grapes is a dry red wine of a certain standard quality. It is the best selling red wine of Turkey. It is ruby red, rather bulky with light tannin. It has an aroma of cherry, banana, spice, and strawberry. It is light-bodied, broad and refreshing. It must be consumed in two or four years after its production date. (Carignan, Bo&#287~azkere ve Öküzgözü üzümlerinden üretilen Yakut, yakut k&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~s&#305~ renginde, oldukça hacimli, hafif tanenli ve Türkiyenin en çok sat&#305~lan, kalitesini belli bir standarda oturtmu&#351~ olan k&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~ sek &#351~arab&#305~d&#305~r. Üretim tarihinden itibaren 2-4 sene içerisinde tüketilmelidir.)<p>Suggesstions (Tavsiyeler): It is a good match with any kind of meal with meat, and all cheeses except cheeses with herb and white cheese. 321;Wine: Kavaklidere Cankaya - White (Sarap: Kavaklidere Cankaya - Beyaz);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. 322;Wine: Kavaklidere Selection Red (Sarap: Kavaklidere Selection Kirmizi);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Selection Red which is one of our prestige wines is produced from most distinguished "Öküzgözü" and "Bo&#287~azkere" grapes. It is bottled after it is rested in the cuvee for a long time, and the process of aging continues in the bottle. The selected grape types and used production method give this wine necessary character and strength for aging. Its "bouquet" develops when it is aged in the bottle. The tannins in wine become elegant. The Selection Red which is dark red, and claret, has an aroma of red fruit, spice, and red currant. It has an astringent, full-bodied, dense, and vivid finish. (Prestij &#351~araplar&#305~m&#305~zdan biri olan Selection K&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~, en seçkin Öküzgözü ve Bo&#287~azkere üzümlerinden üretilir. 323;Wine: Kavaklidere Öküzgözü - Red (Sarap: Kavaklidere Öküzgözü - Kirmizi);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Öküzgözü which is among our mono-coupage products could only be produced in a limited amount and put on the market for those who prefer a different taste. This wine is aged for 12 months in French oak casks known for their finesse and richness of their aroma, and it is developed in bottles for another year. Öküzgözü is lightly dense vivid red, and has an aroma of oak cask and spice. It is fruity, broad, light-bodied, and lasting. The structure of wine makes it possible to develop further in the bottle for another 6-8 years. (Monocépage ürünlerimiz aras&#305~na kat&#305~lan Öküzgözü, farkl&#305~ bir damak tad&#305~ arzulayanlar için, ancak s&#305~n&#305~rl&#305~ say&#305~da üretilebilmi&#351~ ve sat&#305~&#351~a sunulmu&#351~tur. Bu &#351~arap, inceli&#287~i ve aromalar&#305~n&#305~n zenginli&#287~i ile tan&#305~nan Frans&#305~z me&#351~e f&#305~ç&#305~larda 12 ay boyunca bekletildikten sonra, bir sene boyunca da &#351~i&#351~ede geli&#351~imi takip edilir. Öküzgözü hafif yo&#287~un canl&#305~ k&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~ renkte, me&#351~e f&#305~ç&#305~ ve baharat aromal&#305~d&#305~r. A&#287~&#305~zda meyveli, yuvarlak, hafif yap&#305~l&#305~ ve kal&#305~c&#305~d&#305~r. &#350~arab&#305~n yap&#305~s&#305~, &#351~i&#351~ede en az 6-8 y&#305~l süre ile iyi bir geli&#351~im göstermesini sa&#287~lar.)<p>Suggesstions (Tavsiyeler): Öküzgözü is best when served at 18-20 degree. It is a perfect match with different meals with cheese sauce, casseroles, red meat, grills, cheese, and chicken. (Peynir soslu de&#287~i&#351~ik yemekler, güveçler, k&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~ et, &#305~zgaralar, peynirler ve tavukla çok iyi uyum sa&#287~layan Öküzgözü nün ideal içim derecesi 18-20 C dir.)<p>Area of Grapes (Uzum Bolgeleri): Öküzgözü.<p>Color (Renk): Bright red, slightly concentrated. (Canl&#305~ k&#305~rm&#305~z&#305~, hafif yo&#287~un.)<p>Smell (Koku): Oak barrel, fruity. 326;Raki: Tekel Yeni Raki - Turkish Special Drink (Raki: Tekel Yeni Raki);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Raki (rah-KUH) is clear brandy made from grapes and raisins, flavored with pungent anise, and diluted with water. It's similar to Greek ouzo and French pastis. When mixed with ice and/or water for drinking, it turns milky white. Because of its color and alcoholic punch, Turks call it lion's milk (aslan sütü). If you like licorice and anise, you might like Raki.  A traditional raki sofrasi ("raki table") bears dozens of meze (MEH-zeh, Turkish hot and cold hors d'oeuvres, salads, cheeses, etc.) While sipping raki and nibbling meze, there's good conversation, much humor, and many toasts to your companions' health and prosperity. Sherefe or Cheers to your health!<p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. 333;Arak: Kefraya Arak - Lebanese Drink (Arak: Kefraya Arak - Lubnan Ickisi);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age.  (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Arak de Kefraya is a white alcohol where the very best French distillation methods are matched with Lebanese tradition. Its elaboration is as follows: The vats of wine which are less qualified to be part of Chateau or Les Bretèches are distilled. With a first distillation (Armagnac method) a first alcohol at 67% is obtained. This alcohol is distilled a second time to take out methanol which is a toxic substance for health. The third distillation is made in a still from Charentes where the best fresh green aniseed of the world produced in Syria is poured. Thus, a first Arak which is re-distilled in order to concentrate the aniseed flavours, is obtained. The Arak de Kefraya is methanol free after being distilled four times. Traditionally in Lebanon, Arak goes with mezzes. In Europe, it is most tasted as aperitif with water and ice cubs. <p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. 355;Arak: El Massaya Arak (Arak: El Massaya Arak);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>After a period of rest, we put the wine into a copper still or "Alambic Charentais" for the distillation. The heat for the distillation process is insured here by gentle and neutral fires of vine wood embers. The alcoholic vapours migrate through the copper pipe of the still and go through a cooling device. Then, the alcohol from the wine condenses and drips into a vat.The first distillation (eight hours) creates the gift of alcohol, the second (eight hours) removes impurities and leaves the "heart" of the alcohol, "coeur de chouf", while the third (twenty four hours) gives the arak its purity and distinction.  We combine the third distillation with the maceration of the very best green aniseeds. <p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. 339;3 Bottle Offer (3 Sise Ozel Fiyati): Arak: Kefraya Arak-Lebanese Drink(Arak: Kefraya Arak-Lubnan Ic;Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age.  (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Arak de Kefraya is a white alcohol where the very best French distillation methods are matched with Lebanese tradition. Its elaboration is as follows: The vats of wine which are less qualified to be part of Chateau or Les Bretèches are distilled. With a first distillation (Armagnac method) a first alcohol at 67% is obtained. This alcohol is distilled a second time to take out methanol which is a toxic substance for health. The third distillation is made in a still from Charentes where the best fresh green aniseed of the world produced in Syria is poured. Thus, a first Arak which is re-distilled in order to concentrate the aniseed flavours, is obtained. The Arak de Kefraya is methanol free after being distilled four times. Traditionally in Lebanon, Arak goes with mezzes. In Europe, it is most tasted as aperitif with water and ice cubs. The vats of wine which are less qualified to be part of Château or Les Bretèches are distilled. With a first distillation (Armagnac method), alcohol at 67% is obtained. This alcohol is distilled a second time to take out methanol which is a toxic substance for health. The third distillation is made in a still from Charentes where the best fresh green aniseed of the world produced in Syria is poured. Thus, a first Arak which is redistilled in order to concentrate the aniseed flavours, is obtained. The Arak de Kefraya is methanol free after being distilled four times. Traditionally in Lebanon, Arak goes with mezzes. In Europe, it is most tasted as aperitif with water and ice cubs.<p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. 341;3 Bottle Offer (3 Sise Ozel Fiyati): Raki: Tekel Club Raki (Raki: Tekel Kulup Raki);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.)<p>Raki (rah-KUH) is clear brandy made from grapes and raisins, flavored with pungent anise, and diluted with water. It's similar to Greek ouzo and French pastis. When mixed with ice and/or water for drinking, it turns milky white. Because of its color and alcoholic punch, Turks call it lion's milk (aslan sütü). If you like licorice and anise, you might like Raki.  A traditional raki sofrasi ("raki table") bears dozens of meze (MEH-zeh, Turkish hot and cold hors d'oeuvres, salads, cheeses, etc.) While sipping raki and nibbling meze, there's good conversation, much humor, and many toasts to your companions' health and prosperity. Sherefe or Cheers to your health!<p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. Öküzgözü is lightly dense vivid red, and has an aroma of oak cask and spice. It is fruity, broad, light-bodied, and lasting. 374;3 Bottle Offer (3 Sise Ozel Fiyati):  Arak: El Massaya Arak (Arak: El Massaya Arak);Shipping is included for all wines & spirits! - No purchase may be made by anyone under 21 years of age. (21 yasindan kucuklere icki satisi yapilmaz.) <p>After a period of rest, we put the wine into a copper still or "Alambic Charentais" for the distillation. The heat for the distillation process is insured here by gentle and neutral fires of vine wood embers. The alcoholic vapours migrate through the copper pipe of the still and go through a cooling device. Then, the alcohol from the wine condenses and drips into a vat. The first distillation (eight hours) creates the gift of alcohol, the second (eight hours) removes impurities and leaves the "heart" of the alcohol, "coeur de chouf", while the third (twenty four hours) gives the arak its purity and distinction. We combine the third distillation with the maceration of the very best green aniseeds. <p>Please contact us if you wish to order larger number of bottles. 407;Toiletries: PeRaJa Lemon Cologne-450 ml.  (Banyo Malzemeleri: PeReJa Limon Kolonyasi-450 ml.);Cool PeReJa Lemon Cologne in a Plastic Bottle. (Plastik Sise'de Serinletici PeReJa Lemon Kolonyasi.)<p>Info (Bilgi): Perfumes based on alcohol first appeared in Ottoman Turkey during the early years of the reign of Sultan Abdülhamid II (1876-1909). Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life.  The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. You are likely to be offered cologne not only in homes, but on intercity buses, whose passengers are looked upon as guests. When visiting someone who is ill or buying souvenirs for friends during a visit to another part of the country, a bottle of cologne is one of the most acceptable gifts.<p>Weight (Agirlik): 33.81 fl. oz. (1000 ml.);YC-1200;51;7.99;6.99;images/product/PeReJa_Kolonya-T.jpg;images/product/PeReJa_Kolonya-Q.jpg;images/product/PeReJa_Kolonya-Z.jpg;Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;12.00;0;0;0;160,161,159;
408;Meat Products: Ohanyans Bastirma-Curried Dried Beef Strip-1 lbs. (Et Urunleri: Ohanyans Pastirma);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Beef, Salt, Water, Spices, Garlic, Paprika, Sodium Nitrite, Sodium Erythorbate. (Dana Eti, Tuz, Su, Baharatlar, Sarimsak, Kirmizi Biber, Sodyum Nitrit, Sodyum Erythorbat.)<p>Info (Bilgi): The Turkish horsemen of Central Asia used to preserve meat by placing slabs of it in pockets on the sides of their saddles, where it would be pressed by their legs as they rode. This pressed meat was the forerunner of todays past&#305~rma, a term which literally means being pressed in Turkish, and is the origin of the Italian pastrami.  Past&#305~rma is delicious with fresh crusty bread, grilled lightly over charcoal, fried in butter with eggs or in layered pastry börek. Haricot bean stew with pieces of past&#305~rma is another popular dish in Turkey. Past&#305~rma is a favourite meze with rak&#305~, Turkeys national aniseed drink. If you visit one of the meyhanes (taverns) in Beyo&#287~lu in Istanbul, do not forget to try the delicious paçanga börek made with past&#305~rma.<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri):<p>Calories (Enerji): 120 kcal.<p>Total Fat (Toplam Yag): 3.5 g.<p>Saturated Fat (Doymus Yag): 1.5 g.<p>Cholesterol (Kolesterol): 40 mg.<p>Total Carbohydrate (Toplam Karbonhidrat): 4 g.<p>Dietary Fiber (Lifi): 0 g.<p>Sugars (Sekerler): 0 g.<p> Protein (Protein): 18 g.<p>Weight (Agirlik): 16 oz. 420;Coffee: Istanbul Turkish Coffee - 17.64 oz. (Kahve: Istanbul Kahve - 500 gr.);Excellent Turkish Ground Coffee from Istanbul Coffee (Istanbul Kahve'den mukemmel bir kahve) <p>The Recipe for Turkish Coffee: Turkish Coffe traditionally prepared in a small long handled pot (Cezve). For medium-sweet cofee, add one T-sponful of sugar per cup. Place Cezve on a low heat with one heaped T-Spoon Turkish Cofee per cupfull of water and sugar to taste. Heat slowly, stirring gently until the sugar dissolves. When the coffee begins to froth up, remove fom the heat, pour a little of the froth into each cup and return to the heat. Let the coffee rise one more- without letting it come to boil- and serve. Enjoy. <p>Turkish coffee is made of finely pulverized roasted coffee beans. Roasting degree and duration differ according to taste. Coffee is sold either green, or roasted beans or in pulverized form in small shops called " Kuru Yemisçi " which means a person who sells all kinds of nuts, dried fruits, candy bars, bon-bons, coffee varieties, alcoholic drinks and miscellaneous. In old houses a brass-made hand manupulated coffee mill would be used to pulverize coffee beans. An electrical coffee mill is used instead of brass-coffee mill at present time in many households. Turkish coffee is prepared in 4 ways. <p>"Az Sekerli" means coffee has little sugar about 1/2 teaspoon.<p> "Orta Sekerli" means coffee has standart amount of sugar 1 teaspoon. <p>"Çok Sekerli" means coffee has more sugar than enough which is 1 1/2 teaspoons. <p>"Sade Kahve" means black coffee, without sugar. <p>Turkish coffee is served in demitasses made of porcelain. They come in different sizes.However an average demitasse is equal to 1/4 cup in volume. Coffee is served for guest with bon-bon, candy bar or with " Lokum " (Turkish Delight) or with chocolate bars. It is served usually during midday or following a lunch or dinner. There is an old saying about coffee which goes like this. " Bir kahve fincanin kirk yil hatiri vardir " meaning that if one has offered a demitasse of coffee he is obliged for forty years to the one who offered the coffee. It means that the person who offers the coffee is to be respected, honoured, and remembered for a long time for the sake of his coffee offering.<p>(Kahve Recetesi: Icme suyunu fincanla olcerek cezveye koyunuz. Her fincan icin iki kucuk kasik kahve, arzunuza gore seker ilave ediniz (orta icin iki kasik). Kisik ateste kahve ve sekeri iyice karistiriniz. Bir sure sonra kabaran kopugu fincanlara pay ediniz. Kalan kahveyi bir tasim daha pisiriniz ve fincanlara bosaltiniz. Afiyet olsun.) <p>Weight: 17.64 oz. (500 grams) ;YC-000134A;0;9.49;8.89;images/product/Istanbul Coffee-T.jpg;images/product/Istanbul Coffee-Q.jpg;images/product/Istanbul Coffee-Q.jpg;Turkish Coffee (Turk Kahvesi);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Turkish & Other Coffees (Turk ve Diger Kahveler),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;10.00;0;0;0;40,421,423;

For medium-sweet cofee, add one T-sponful of sugar per cup. Place Cezve on a low heat with one heaped T-Spoon Turkish Cofee per cupfull of water and sugar to taste. Heat slowly, stirring gently until the sugar dissolves. When the coffee begins to froth up, remove fom the heat, pour a little of the froth into each cup and return to the heat. Let the coffee rise one more- without letting it come to boil- and serve. Enjoy. <p>Turkish coffee is made of finely pulverized roasted coffee beans. Coffee is sold either green, or roasted beans or in pulverized form in small shops called " Kuru Yemisçi " which means a person who sells all kinds of nuts, dried fruits, candy bars, bon-bons, coffee varieties, alcoholic drinks and miscellaneous. In old houses a brass-made hand manupulated coffee mill would be used to pulverize coffee beans. An electrical coffee mill is used instead of brass-coffee mill at present time in many households. 555;Desserts & Pastries: Dr. Oetker Revani (Tatlilar & Hamur Isleri: Dr. Oetker Revani);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Wheat Flour, Sugar, Wheat Semolina, Emulsufier, Raising Agents, Nature identical flavours-Vanilin, Salt. (Bugday Unu, Seker, Bugday Irmigi, Emulgator, Kabarticilar, dogala ozdes aroma-Vanilin, Tuz.)<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri):<p>Calories (Enerji): 204 kcal.<p>Protein (Protein): 2.40 g.<p>Fat (Yag): 1.00 g.<p>Carbohydrate (Karbonhidrat): 46.40 g.<p> Necessary Ingredients (Gerekli Malzemeler): 1 bag of Dr. Oetker Revani, 3 eggs, 100ml-1 cup milk, per your desire chopped orange and lemon peal, coconuts or wallnuts.  (1 poset Dr. Oetker Revani, 3 yumurta, 100 ml.-1 cay bardagi sut, arzuya gore 1 portakal, limon kabugu, Hindistan cevizi veya ceviz rendesi.)<p>Syrup Ingredients (Surup icin): 600 gram-3.5 cup sugar, 1 liter-5.5 glass of water, 1 tea spoon of lemon. (600 gram-3.5 su bardagi toz seker, 1 litre-5.5 su bardagi su, 1 tatli kasigi limon suyu.)<p>Preperation (Hazirlanisi): <p>Add the water and sugar in a saucepan and boil it while stirring it occesionally.  When it boils, add the lemon juice and boil it for 5 more minutes. Then, take it out of the heat and let it cool.<p>Pour contents of the Dr. Oetker Revani into a mixing bowl.  Add eggs and milk and mix it 5 minutes with a mixer. Pour the mix into a slighty buttered 28 cm diameter or similar size pan and place it to 320F preheated owen.  Bake it 35-45 minutes until it turns to a pinkish color. Take it out of the owen and let it cool for 5 minutes.  Cut it into fours and begin pouring slowly the cold syrup by starting from the edges.  When it cools, cut it to the desired sizes and sprinkle any of the chopped content on top it.  Bon Appettite!<p>(Surup icin olculu suyu ve sekerli tencereye koyup arada karistirarak kaynamaya birakin.  Kaynamaya baslayinca limon suyunu ekleyip 5 dakika daha kaynatin.  Ocaktan alip sogmaya birakin.<p>Revani posetini cirpma kabina birakin. Uzerine yumurta ve sutu ilave edip mikser ile 5 dakika cirpin.  Yaglanmis 28cm capindaki tepsiye dokup onceden 160C'ye isitilmis firinda uzeri pembelesinceye kadar, yaklasik 35-45 dakika pisirin.  Firindan aldiktan sonra, 5 dakika sogumaya birakin ve dorde bolun.  Uzerine sogumus surubu, tepsinin kenarlarindan baslayarak ortaya dogru yavas yavas dokun.  Soguduktan sonra dilimleyin ve arzuya gore Hindistan cevizi rendesi, dovulmus Antep fistigi, ceviz ile susleyerek veya kaymak ile servis yapin. Afiyet Olsun.)<p>Weight (Agirlik): 17.64 oz (500 gram);YC-DO255;50;4.99;3.99;images/product/Dr Oetker Revani -T.jpg;images/product/Dr Oetker Revani -Q.jpg;images/product/Dr Oetker Revani -Z.jpg;Desserts & Pastries (Tatlilar & Hamur Isleri);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Desserts & Pastries (Tatlilar & Hamur Isleri),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;7.00;0;0;0;546,457,220;

711;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Pistachio Traditional Cut-16oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Fist;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST PISTACHIO TURKISH DELIGHT". The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling.<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Pistachio, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. (Seker, Su, Fistik, Misir Nisastasi, Vanilin Aromasi.)<p>Type (Cesidi): Pistachio-Traditional Cut. (Fistikli-Buyuk Kesim.)<p>Weight (Agirlik): 16 oz. 546;Desserts & Pastries: Dr.Oetker Tulumba Dessert-10.6oz.(Tatlilar & Hamur Isleri: Tulumba Tatlisi-300;Ingredients (Icindekiler):  Wheat Flour, Sugar, Emulsifer, Modified starch, Dextrose, Salt. (Bugday Unu, Seker, Emulgator, Modifiye nisasta, dekstroz, Yemeklik tuz.)<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri):<p>Calories (Enerji): 225 kcal.<p>Protein (Protein): 2.75 g.<p>Fat (Yag): 17 g.<p>Carbohydrate (Karbonhidrat): 15.30 g.<p>Directions and cooking ingredients (Tarifi ve pisirme icin gerekli malzemeler):<p>150 gram (one pauch) of this box' contents (kutunun icindekiler)<p>For Loaf (Hamur icin): 250 ml-2.5 tea glass water, 1 spoon of margarine, 2 eggs. (250 ml.-2.5 cay bardagi su, 1 tatli kasigi margarin, 2 yumurta.)<p>For Syrup: 375 gram-2 water glasses sugar, 250 ml-2.5 tea glass water, 1 spoon of lemon juice.<p>1. Syrup Preperation(Surubun Hazirlanisi): Add required water and sugar in a saucepan.  Boil by stirring occesionally.  When it begins boiling, add lemon juice and take it out of the heat after 1 minute.  (Surubu hazirlamak icin, olculu suyu ve sekeri tencereye koyun.  Arada karistirarak kaynamaya birakin.  Kaynamaya baslayinca, limon suyunu ilave edin ve 1 dakika sonra ocaktan alip sogumaya birakin.)<p>2. Loaf's Preperation (Hamurun Hazirlanisi): Add required water and margarine in sacuepan and boil.  When it begins boiling, add the contents of the package and stir it with a wood spoon till it becomes loaf.  Boil 2-3 minutes more and place it into a wide mixing bowl.  Then, let it cool before adding eggs and mixing with mixer for 6 to 7 minutes.) Bir tencereye su ve margarini koyup kaynatin.  Kaynamay baslayinca un paketini ilave edin ve tahta kasikla karistirarak hamur haline gelinceye kadar-yaklasik 2-3 dakika pisirin. Genis bir cirpma kabina alip soguttuktan sonra, mikserin hamur uclari ile karistirarak birer birer yumurtalari ilave edin ve yaklasik 6-7 dakika daha karistirmaya devam edin.<p>3.Cooking (Pisirme): Pour any liquid oil to a wide cooking pan~ however, do not heat it. Place the loaf to a shaping bag and cut the shaped loaf coming out of the shaping bag to 1 inch size.  Place these small loafs to the cookin pan.  Once the pan is full, start cooking it in high heat.  When they are fried, take them out with wide spoon and dump them into cold syrup.  Let it wait in the cold syrup and place it into serving dish.  Bon Appetite!  (Genis bir kizartma kabina bol miktarda sivi yag koyun, ancak atesi acmayin.  hamurdan sekillendirme torbasina doldurun ve siktiginizda uctan cikan sekilli hamuru, yaglanmis iki parmaginiz ile 2-3 cm boylarinda koparip soguk yaga atin. 678;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Hazelnut-Traditional Cut-16oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Fin;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST HAZELNUT TURKISH DELIGHT". The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling.<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Hazelnut, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. (Seker, Su, Findik, Misir Nisastasi, Vanilin Aromasi.)<p>Type (Cesidi): Hazelnut-Traditional Cut. (Findikli-Buyuk Kesim.)<p>Weight (Agirlik): 16 oz. 712;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Pistachio-Mini Cut-8.8oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Fistikli K;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST PISTACHIO TURKISH DELIGHT" The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling. <p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Pistachio, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. (Seker, Su, Fistik, Misir Nisastasi, Vanilin Aromasi.) <p>Type (Cesidi): Pistachio-Mini Cut: Mini Turkish Delights. (Fistikli-Kucuk Kesim: Mini Lokum.) <p>Weight (Agirlik): 8.8 oz. 713;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Mixed-Traditional Cut-16oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Karisik-;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST MIXED TURKISH DELIGHT" The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling. <p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Pistachio, Lemon flavor, Rose flavor, Orange falvor, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. 715;Cooking & Baking Needs: Piyale Ezogelin Pilaf (Pisirme & Firin Malzemeleri: Piyale Ezogelin Pilavi);Preperation (Pisirme Tarifi):  Pour 450 to 550 ml.-3 to 4 water glasses of water and 3 to 4 table spoon of oil in to a saucepan. Once it starts boiling add 1 dessert spoon of salt and contents of the package.  Bring to low heat, close the lid of the sauce pan and stir occesionally.  Once the water is vaporized, take the saucepan from the heat and let it rest for 10-15 minutes, and serve.  Bon Appetite. (1 litre) (910 gr.) ;YC-KG101;50;4.99;3.99;images/product/Kirlangic_Aycicekyagi_1000ml-T.jpg;images/product/Kirlangic_Aycicekyagi_1000ml-Q.jpg;images/product/Kirlangic_Aycicekyagi_1000ml-Z.jpg;Oils (Sivi Yaglar);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore),Express-Oils (Sivi Yaglar);New;;;;9.00;0;0;0;36,525,727;
764;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Hazelnut-Traditional Cut-8.8oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Find;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST HAZELNUT TURKISH DELIGHT". The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling. Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Hazelnut, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. (Seker, Su, Findik, Misir Nisastasi, Vanilin Aromasi.) <p>Type (Cesidi): Hazelnut-Traditional Cut. (Findikli-Buyuk Kesim.) <>Weight (Agirlik): 8.8 oz. 765;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Rose & Lemon-Mini Cut-8.8oz.(Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-Gullu &;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST ROSE & LEMON TURKISH DELIGHT" The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling. <p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Pistachio, Lemon flavor, Rose flavor, Orange falvor, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. 832;Ceramics: Kutahya Modern Blue-3.94 in. (Seramikler: Kutahya Modern Mavi-10 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik)<p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern)<p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Cap:): 3.94 in. (10 cm)<p>Shipped in a velvet box. 843;Desserts & Pastries: Dr.Oetker Profiterol-12.7oz.(Tatlilar & Hamur Isleri: Dr.Oetker Profiterol-360;Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Wheat flour, Midified starch, Cocoa Powder, Corn Starch, Thickner, Chocolate Powder, Emulsifier, Raising agents, Nature identical flavor, Salt, Colorant. (Seker, Bugday Unu, Modifiye Nisasta, Kivam verici, Cikolata tozu, Emulgator, Kabarticilar, Yemeklik tuz, Renklendirici.)<p>Preperation (Hazirlanisi):<p>1. Loaf and Sauce Preperation(Hamurun ve Sosun Hazirlanisi):  Heat water and margarine in pan.  Pour flour mix on top of them and stir until it becomes a loaf.  Take it from the heat and let it cool. Meanwhile for the chocolate sauce, add the chocolate mix and milk to a saucepan.  Boil the mix while stirring for 2-3 minutes.  Take it from the heat and let it cool, stirring occasionally.(Su ve margarini kaynatin.  Uzerine un karisimini ilave edip devamli karistirarak yaklasik 1 dakika hamur haline gelinceye kadar pisirin.  Daha sonra ocaktan alip sogumaya birakin.  Cikolatali sos karisimina sut ilave edip orta ateste surekli karistirarak yaklasik 2-3 dakika kaynatin.  Ocaktan alip arada karistirarak sogumaya birakin.)<p>2. Cooking (Pisirme): Once the load is cooled for 10-15 minutes, add eggs and mix it with mixer for 5 minutes.  Take 1/2 a spoon of pieces of the loaf and place it on a oiled pan. Place this pan to the 400 F preheated oven and bake it at 350 F for 20 minutes.  Take it our from the oven and let it cool. (Hamuru 10-15 dakika soguttuktan sonra uzeine yumurtalari ilave edip mikser ile 5 dakika carpin. Hamurdan yarim tatli kasigi buyuklugunde parcalar alip baska bir kasik yardimiyla yaglanmis firin tepsisine aralikli koyun.  Onceden 200 C derceye isitilimis firinda 20 dakika pisirin 150 C'ye dusurup iyice pembelesinceye kadar, yaklasik 15-25 dakika daha pisirin.  Firindan aldiktan sonra iyice soguyuncaya kadar bekletin.)<p>3.  Cream Preparation (Kremanin hazirlanisi):  Mix Milk and cream mix with mixer for 3-4 minutes.  Take this mix and pour into the injection tube.  Either open up a small hole in the profiterol balls or cut in half and fill inside with this cream.  One all are complete, pour the chocolate sauce on top of it before serving.  (Sut ile krema karisimini mikser ile once dusuk sonra yuksek devirde, yaklasik 3-4 dakika cirpin. 861;Toiletries: Bogazici Lemon Cologne-Glass-460cc(Banyo Malzemeleri: Bogazici Limon Kolonyasi-Cam-460c;Refreshing Lemon Cologene in a Glass Bottle (Cam Sise'de Ferahlatici Limon Kolonyasi)<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Ethil Alcohol, Lemon Fregarance, Di-ionized Water. (Etil Alkol, Limon Esansi, Deiyonize Su.)<p>Info (Bilgi): Perfumes based on alcohol first appeared in Ottoman Turkey during the early years of the reign of Sultan Abdülhamid II (1876-1909). Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. You are likely to be offered cologne not only in homes, but on intercity buses, whose passengers are looked upon as guests. When visiting someone who is ill or buying souvenirs for friends during a visit to another part of the country, a bottle of cologne is one of the most acceptable gifts. <p>Weight (Agirlik): 15 fl. oz. (460 cc.);YC-BIK00151;50;7.99;7.89;images/product/Bogazici_Kolonya_Cologne-T.jpg;images/product/Bogazici_Kolonya_Cologne-Q.jpg;images/product/Bogazici_Limon_Kolonyasi-Z.jpg;Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),Express-Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore);New;;;;10.00;0;0;0;159,160,815;

955;Ceramics: Kutahya Modern Black-3.94 in. (Seramikler: Kutahya Modern-Siyah-10 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik)<p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern)  <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Cap:): 3.94 in. (10 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. 977;Ceramics: Kutahya Free Form-Blue/Red Tulip-3.94 in.(Seramikler: Kütahya Serbest Desen-Mavi/Kirmizi;Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kütahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Cap:): 3.94 in. (10 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.) <p>SET OF SIX! (ALTILI SET!)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 988;Books-Turkish (Kitaplar-Türkçe): Köstebek-Necip Hablemito&#287~lu;Author (Yazar): Necip Hablemitoglu (Necip Hablemito&#287~lu)<p>Type (Konu): History & Life (Tarih & Hayat)<p>ISBN: 975-677-494-0<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Kostebek (Köstebek)<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 416<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 13x19.4cm~ 2.Hamur <p>Publisher (Matbaa): Toplumsal Dönüsüm Yayinlari<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Feb.(Subat) 2003 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): "Türk genci, inkilaplarin ve rejimin sahibi ve bekçisidir. Bunlarin lüzumuna ve dogruluguna herkesten çok inanmistir~ rejimi ve inkilaplari benimsemistir. Bunlari zayif düsürecek en küçük veya en büyük bir kipirti ve bir hareket oldu mu: "Bu memleketin polisi vardir, jandarmasi vardir, ordusu vardir, adliyesi vardir..." demeyecektir, hemen müdahale edecektir: elle, tasla, sopa ve silahla... nesi varsa onunla, kendi eserini koruyacaktir. Polis gelecektir~ asil suçlulari birakip, suçlu diye onu yakalayacaktir. Genç, "Polis, henüz inkilap ve Cumhuriyetin polisi degildir." diye düsünecek, fakat asla yalvarmayacaktir. Mahkeme onu mahkum edecektir. Yine düsünecek: "Demek adliyeyi de islah etmek gerek, rejime göre düzenlemek lazim!... diye düsünecektir. Onu hapse atacaklar. Kanun yolundan itirazlarini yapmakla beraber, bana, Ismet Pasa'ya, Meclis'e telgraflar yagdirip hakli ve suçsuz oldugu için tahliyesine çalisilmasini istemeyecek ve diyecek ki: "Ben inancimin ve kanaatimin icabini yaptim. Müdahale ve hareketimde hakliyim. Eger buraya haksiz olarak gelmissem, bu haksizligi meydana getiren sebep ve amilleri düzeltmk de benim vazifemdir!..."<p>Iste benimanladigim Türk gencive Türk gençligi!...5 Subat 1933 Bursa- K. Atatürk<p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.)<p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 990;Ceramics: Kutahya Free Form-II Colorful-10 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Serbest Desen Renkli-25 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Free Form (Serbest Desen)<p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Cap:): 10 in. (25 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1002;Ceramics: Kutahya Modern Blue-7.09 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Modern Blue-18 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern)<p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Cap:): 7.09 in. (18 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Çap:): 10 in. (25 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. 1040;Ceramics: Kutahya Free Form-II Blue/White-16 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Serbest Desen Mavi/Beyaz-40 cm;Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kütahya, Turkiye'den mükemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Free Form (Serbest Desen) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kütahya, Turkiye'den mükemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Modern (Modern) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. 1100;Ceramics: Kutahya Tile Classic-I Colorful 8 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Koro Klasik Renkli-20 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Free Form (Serbest Desen) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 8 in. (20 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.) <p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1116;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Snow-Orhan Pamuk - U.K Edition;Author (Yazar): Orhan Pamuk <p>Type (Konu): Life & Fiction (Yasam & &#336~ykü) <p>ISBN: 0-571-22065-7<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 436 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): Peperback<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Faber<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Aug.(Agustos) 2004<p>Description (Aciklamalar): A Turkish poet who spent 12 years as a political exile in Germany witnesses firsthand the clash between radical Islam and Western ideals in this enigmatically beautiful novel. Ka's reasons for visiting the small Turkish town of Kars are twofold: curiosity about the rash of suicides by young girls in the town and a hope to reconnect with "the beautiful Ipek," whom he knew as a youth. But Kars is a tangle of poverty-stricken families, Kurdish separatists, political Islamists (including Ipek's spirited sister Kadife) and Ka finds himself making compromises with all in a desperate play for his own happiness. Ka encounters government officials, idealistic students, leftist theater groups and the charismatic and perhaps terroristic Blue while trying to convince Ipek to return to Germany with him~ each conversation pits warring ideologies against each other and against Ka's own weary melancholy. Pamuk himself becomes an important character, as he describes his attempts to piece together "what really happened" in the few days his friend Ka spent in Kars, during which snow cuts off the town from the rest of the world and a bloody coup from an unexpected source hurtles toward a startling climax. Pamuk's sometimes exhaustive conversations and descriptions create a stark picture of a too-little-known part of the world, where politics, religion and even happiness can seem alternately all-consuming and irrelevant. A detached tone and some dogmatic abstractions make for tough reading, but Ka's rediscovery of God and poetry in a desolate place makes the novel's sadness profound and moving. Copyright © Reed Business Information, a division of Reed Elsevier Inc. <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.)<p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days.
