1121;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Ataturk:The Biography of the Founder of Modern Turkey-Andrew Ma;Author (Yazar): Andrew Mango<p>Type (Konu): Biographies (Biografiler)<p>ISBN: 158567334X <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 539 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): N/A <p>Publisher (Matbaa): Overlook Publishingp>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Aug.(Agustos) 2002 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Andrew Mango strips away the myth, to show the complexities of one of the most visionary, influential, and enigmatic statesmen of the century. Mustafa Kemal Ataturk was virtually unknown until 1919, when he took the lead in thwarting the victorious Allies' plan to partition the Turkish core of the Ottoman Empire. He divided the Allies, defeated the last Sultan, and secured the territory of the Turkish national state, becoming the first president of the new republic in 1923, fast creating his own legend.<p>Andrew Mango's revealing portrait of Ataturk throws light on matters of great importance today-resurgent nationalism, religious fundamentalism, and the reality of democracy.  <p>© All rights reserved. 1152;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Crescent & Star-Stephen Kinzer;Author (Yazar): Stephen Kinzer<p>Type (Konu): Politics & History (Politika & Tarih) <p>ISBN: 0-374-13143-0 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): CRESCENT AND STAR : Turkey Between Two Worlds<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 252 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): N/A <p>Publisher (Matbaa): Farrar Publishing<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Sept.(Eylul) 2002 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): For centuries few terrors were more vivid in the West than fear of "the Turk," and many people still think of Turkey as exotic and dangerous. Crescent and Star is Stephen Kinzer's report on the truth about this nation of contradictions  poised between Europe and Asia, between the glories of its Ottoman past and its hopes for a democratic future, between the dominance of its army and the needs of its civilian citizens, between its secular expectations and its Muslim traditions.<p>Kinzer vividly describes Turkey's captivating delights as he smokes a water pipe, searches for the ruins of lost civilizations, watches a camel fight, and discovers its greatest poet. But he is also attuned to the political landscape, taking us from Istanbul's elegant cafes to wild mountain outposts on Turkey's eastern borders, while along the way he talks to dissidents and patriots, villagers and cabinet ministers. He reports on political trials and on his own arrest by Turkish soldiers when he was trying to uncover secrets about the army's campaigns against Kurdish guerillas. He explores the nation's hope to join the European Union, the human-rights abuses that have kept it out, and its difficult relations with Kurds, Armenians, and Greeks.  <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 1179;Ceramics: Kutahya Jar Shah-II Free Form-12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Kavanoz Sah Serbest Desen-30 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Serbest Desen (Free Form) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. (Kap&#305~n&#305~za kadar teslim masraf&#305~ fiyat&#305~miza dahildir.);KNFF0030-02;50;679.00;549.00;images/product/KNFF0030-02-T.jpg;images/product/KNFF0030-02-Q.jpg;images/product/KNFF0030-02-Z.jpg;Others (Digerleri);Ceramics (Seramik);Jars (Kavanozlar);Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore),Express-Ceramics (Seramikler);New;;;;0.00;0;0;0;;
1180;Ceramics: Kutahya Jar Shah-III Free Form-12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Kavanoz Sah Serbest Desen-30 cm;Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Serbest Desen (Free Form) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. 1181;Ceramics: Kutahya Jar Shah-I Classic-12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Kavanoz Sah Klasik-30 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. 1185;Ceramics: Kutahya Jar Shah-II Classic-12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Kavanoz Sah Klasik-30 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1204;Ceramics: Kutahya Vase Narrow Classic-I Blue/White 12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Ince Klasik Mavi/Beya;Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kutahya, Turkiye'den mukemmel el isi seramik) <p>Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Height (Y&#369~kseklik:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.)<p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1216;Books-Turkish (Kitaplar-Türkçe): Bin Renk Bir Ömür-Osman Önde&#351~;Author (Yazar): Osman Ozdes (Osman Önde&#351~) <p>Type (Konu): Biographies & History (Biografiler & Tarih) <p>ISBN: 975-14-0992-6<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Bin Renk Bir Omur: Sefire Emine Esenbel'in Anilari (Bin Renk Bir Ömür: Sefire Emine Esenbel'in An&#305~lar&#305~)<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 240<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 13.3x19.7cm, siyah-beyaz foto&#287~raflar, 2.Hamur<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Remzi Kitabevi <p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): August (Agustos) 2004 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Sefire Emine Esenbel'in An&#305~lar&#305~. Ö&#287~renim için bir &#304~ngiliz gemisiyle &#304~stanbul'dan kaçan babas&#305~ Bahriye zabiti Ali Naci Bey'in serüvenlerinden çocuk ya&#351~ta etkilenen Emine Esenbel, evlili&#287~inin ard&#305~ndan yurtd&#305~&#351~&#305~nda bir yandan yokluklarla bo&#287~u&#351~urken bir yandan da sanat merkezi olan Paris'in tad&#305~n&#305~ ç&#305~karmaya çal&#305~&#351~&#305~r. Mina Urgan'la Paris sahaflar çar&#351~&#305~s&#305~n&#305~ ke&#351~federler... Fatih Rü&#351~tü Zorlu, Taha Car&#305~m renkli ki&#351~ilikleriyle aile dostlar&#305~ olarak öne ç&#305~karlar...Ankara'da ise Von Papen, Behiç Erkin, Mevhibe &#304~nönü ve Ahmet Dall&#305~ gibi ünlü simalarla dostluklar kurar... 1218;Glassware: Gold Medallian Plate (Cam Eser: Altin Madalyon Tabak);Gold Medallion Plate:  The motif on this handmade plate is based on the Urartian gold medallion discovered at Toprakkale in Van.  This gold medallion is an Urartian work of art depiciting two goddesses making votive offerings, dates from the 7th-6th century BC.  Today it is in the Berlin Museum.  (Alt&#305~n madalyon Tabak: El imalat&#305~ cam tabak üzerinde kullan&#305~lan motif, Van Toprakkale'de bulunmu&#351~ olan Alt&#305~n Modalyon'dan al&#305~nt&#305~d&#305~r.  Iki Urartu tanr&#305~ças&#305~n&#305~n birbirlerine sayg&#305~ sunu&#351~ sahnesini anlatmakta olan Alt&#305~n Madalyon bir Urartu eseridir.  M.&#336~. 7-6.yy.'a tarihlerlenir ve Berlin Müzesi'nde sergilenmektedir.)<p>Height (Yükseklik): 1.4 in. (3.5 cm.) <p>Diameter (Çap): 10.12 in. (25.7 cm.) <p>This Pasabahce product is decorated with gold leaf and should be cleaned by wiping with a slighly damp cloth. 1222;Glassware: Gold 12 Gods Gondola Bowl (Cam Eser: Amber 12 Tanri Mat Altin Gondol);The motif on this handmade glass gondola shaped bowl is based on a stone relief depiciting twelve gods found at the Yazilikaya Rock Temple in Corum. 1224;Glassware: Gold Hasanoglan Vase (Cam Eser: Amber Hasanoglan Mat Altin Vazo);The motif on this handmade vase is based on a Hattian silver figurine found during excavations of the village of Hasanoglan in the province Ankara, Turkey. 1225;Glassware: Jug with Pearls (Cam Eser: Incili Ma&#351~rapa);During Ottoman times guests at the palace were served food and drink in gold vessels encrusted with rubies, emeralds and other gems.  Such vessels made by royal goldsmiths reflected the splendour of the empire.  These vessels are today exhibted in various museum collections.  The Jug with pearls is inspired by a rock crystal jug at Topkapi Place Museum, Istanbul, Turkey.  The ovoid Timurid form jug is entirely handmade and encrusted with colored glass stones and pearls.  (Osmanl&#305~ Imparatorlu&#287~u'nda saltanat g&#337~rkemini yans&#305~tmak amac&#305~yla misafirlere saray kuyumcular&#305~ taraf&#305~ndan yakut zümrüt gibi de&#287~erli ta&#351~lar kullan&#305~larak süslenen alt&#305~n kaplarda yiyecek ve içecekler sunulurdu.  Bu ürünler Osmanl&#305~ Saray Hazinesinin bir parças&#305~ olarak bugün ce&#351~itli müzelerde sergilenmektedir.  Incili Masrapa Topkap&#305~ Sarayi Muzesi'nde sergilenen Necefli Ma&#351~rapa'dan esinlenerek üretilmistir.  &#350~i&#351~kin govdeli Timuri formlu el imalat&#305~ cam ma&#351~rapanin üzeri çiçek ve dal k&#305~vr&#305~mlar&#305~, &#351~emse desenleri ile süslenmis renkli cam taslar ve inciler kullan&#305~larak tamamen el i&#351~çili&#287~i ile dekorlanm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r.)<p>From the long reign of the Ottoman's which commenced 700 years ago and which led to a giant empire, remain inimitable works of art. Dedicated to the memory of this long reign, the Ottoman Collection has been formed to introduce its artistic works which represent the magnificant history of the Ottoman Art and to reflect it to the present day with a new interpretation. The Ottoman Collection products are entirely hand made and deorated by using either gold or silver to offer you the greatest pleasure. (Osmanl&#305~lar'&#305~n 700 y&#305~l once ba&#351~layan ve dev bir imparatorluk olu&#351~turan uzun yürüyu&#351~ünden günümuze e&#351~siz sanat eserleri kald&#305~. 1226;Glassware: Crane Beaker (Cam Eser: Turna Bardak);This handmade beaker is inspired by an antique glass dating from 1250-1275.  It is enamelled with a scene depiciting two fiquires beside a lake, one kneeling the other standing, pointing to cranes in the sky.  Cranes, that "Turne" beaker takes its name, were regarded as a symbol of life.  (1250-1275 y&#305~llar&#305~ aras&#305~nda tarihlenen antik cam bardaktan esinlenerek yap&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r. 1227;Glassware: Nightingale's Eye Blue/White  Vase (Cam Eser: Çesmi Bülbül Mavi/Beyaz Vazo);Color twist glass became known as nightingale's Eye in Turkish, since the swirling designs were thought to resemble the eyes of that bird. These designs are created by means of regularly space rods of colored glass inserted into the molten crystal, which is then twisted, a process demanding a high degree of experience and skill. (Renkli kristal çubuklar bir düzen içinde kristal kütlesine eklenerek dondurulur ve ozel bir ustal&#305~kla burulur. Bu teknikle üretilen camlar&#305~n deseni bülbül gozüne benzetildigi icin Çe&#351~m-i Bülbül (Bülbülün Gozü) olarak adland&#305~r&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r.) <p>In the past, vases, bowls, candy dishes, rosewater sprinklers, tulip vases and similar forms were produced in color twist glass. Today color twist glassware specially produced for Pasabahce Glassware is made entirely by hand, using blowing and other techniques. (Geçmi&#351~te vazo, kase, &#351~ekerlik, gülabdan, laledan gibi formlarda üretilen "Çe&#351~m-i Bülbül" ürünler, günümuzde tamamen el i&#351~çiligi ile Pa&#351~abahçe Ma&#287~zalari A.&#350~. icin &#337~zel olarak üretilmektedir.) <p>Height (Yükseklik): 10.63 in. (27 cm.) <p>Shipped in a handmade velvet wood box. (El yapim&#305~ kadife Ah&#351~ap kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.) <p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1228;Glassware: Ottoman Alem Vase (Cam Eser: Osmanli Alem Vazo);Crescent finials known as alem adorned the domes and minarets of many different Ottoman buildings, secular as well as sacral.  This vase has an interlace motif around the rim and a crescent finial motif on the body.  The vase is handmade and the gilded decoration has also been executed entirely by hand. 1232;Glassware: Fish Motif Parfume Flask (Balikli Parfüm &#350~i&#351~esi);Inspired by an antique glass perfume flask dating from 1260-1280, the flask bears an inscription in early Mamluk script reading:  "For his picture of his Majesty, just Sultan of the world, foundation of the state, ruler of nations..."  From this inscription it is thought that the original flask was made for the Mamluk sultan.  This item takes its name from the fish motif symbolising abundance.  (1260-1280 y&#305~llar&#305~ aras&#305~na tarihlenen antik cam parfüm &#351~i&#351~esinden esinlenerek yap&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r.  &#350~i&#351~e üzerinde erken d&#337~nem Memluk yaz&#305~ karakteri ile "Devletin temeli, milletler hakimi, adaletli, cihan padi&#351~ah&#305~ Efendimizin resmini yapt&#305~&#287~&#305~ndan dolay&#305~..." yazmaktad&#305~r. 1233;Glassware: Flat Charm Parfume Flask (Cam Eser: Yass&#305~ T&#305~ls&#305~m Parfüm &#350~i&#351~esi);This handmade perfume flask is inspired by an antique flask dating from the second half of the 13th Century.  The design consists of crescent moon and a sun in the form of a human face inside a medallian.  The crescent moon is filled with floral motifs reminiscent of dragons.  The combination of moon, sun and dragons tells us that the original bottle has a talismanic function. (13. Yüzy&#305~l'a tarihlenen antik cam parfüm &#351~i&#351~esinden esinlenerek yap&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r.  El imalati cam &#351~i&#351~e üzerinde, madalyon icinde insan yüzü gibi çizilmi&#351~ güne&#351~ ve onu tamaml&#305~yan hilal &#351~eklinde ay figürü resmedilmi&#351~tir.  Ay figürünün ici stilize edilmi&#351~ ejderhalara benzeyen bitkisel motifler ile süslüdur.  Ay, güne&#351~ ve ejderha figurlerinin birlikte kullan&#305~lmas&#305~, &#351~i&#351~enin orjinalinin t&#305~ls&#305~ml&#305~ oldugu anlam&#305~na gelmektedir. (Mineli Camlar Serisi, 12. ve 15. 1234;Glassware: Sakayik Vase (Cam Eser: &#350~akay&#305~k Vazo);This handmade vase is inspired by an antque glass vase dating from the early 14h Century and bearing an inscription in early Mamluk characters reading, " Property of His Majesty, Sultan of the world". 1236;Glassware: Nightingale's Eye Karlikli Pitcher (Cam Eser: Çesmi Bülbül Karlikli Sürahi);Color twist glass became known as nightingale's Eye in Turkish, since the swirling designs were thought to resemble the eyes of that bird.  These designs are created by means of regularly space rods of colored glass inserted into the molten crystal, which is then twisted, a process demanding a high degree of experience and skill.  (Renkli kristal çubuklar bir düzen içinde kristal kütlesine eklenerek dondurulur ve ozel bir ustal&#305~kla burulur.  Bu teknikle üretilen camlar&#305~n deseni bülbül gozüne benzetildigi icin Çe&#351~m-i Bülbül (Bülbülün Gozü) olarak adland&#305~r&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~r.) <p>In the past, vases, bowls, candy dishes, rosewater sprinklers, tulip vases and similar forms were produced in color twist glass.  Today color twist glassware specially produced for Pasabahce Glassware is made entirely by hand, using blowing and other techniques.  (Geçmi&#351~te vazo, kase, &#351~ekerlik, gülabdan, laledan gibi formlarda üretilen "Çe&#351~m-i Bülbül" ürünler, günümuzde tamamen el i&#351~çiligi ile Pa&#351~abahçe Ma&#287~zalari A.&#350~. icin &#337~zel olarak üretilmektedir.)<p>Height (Yükseklik): 11.81 in. (30 cm.) <p>Shipped in a handmade velvet wood box. (El yapim&#305~ kadife Ah&#351~ap kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.) <p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. 1244;Glassware: Nightingale's Eye Cobalt/Green Vase(Cam Eser: Çesmi Bülbül Kobalt/Ye&#351~il Vazo);Color twist glass became known as nightingale's Eye in Turkish, since the swirling designs were thought to resemble the eyes of that bird. These designs are created by means of regularly space rods of colored glass inserted into the molten crystal, which is then twisted, a process demanding a high degree of experience and skill. (Renkli kristal çubuklar bir düzen içinde kristal kütlesine eklenerek dondurulur ve &#337~zel bir ustal&#305~kla burulur. 1251;Ceramics: Kutahya Classic-I Custom Made-12 in.(Seramikler: Kutahya Klasik-I Musteriye Ozel-30 cm);Exquisite hand-made ceramics from Kutahya, Turkey. (Kütahya, Turkiye'den mükemmel el isi seramik)<p> Design Type (Desen Tipi): Classic (Klasik) <p>The origin of Cini ceramics is found in an age-old tale: There once was a mysterious woman who sold cooking ware in the bazaar which was made from a special type of soil. People were fascinated by these pots and pans and after a while they wondered where this woman had obtained the material to make these wonderful wares. Many decided to follow her to find the place where she extracted the special soil. Today, this is the place which is now the Anatolian city called Kutahya. <p>According to historians, Cini was introduced to the world when the Turks entered into Anatolia in 1071 A.D. The various designs and motifs of Cini reflect the shapes and colors of the earth and soil in an artistic way. These ceramics are hand-shaped and hand-painted with care and precision by superior artisans who continue the age-old craft. <p>Cini ceramics figures, designs and motifs evoke an ever-connecting link with the past and nature in truly unique art forms. Look at them carefully, touch them and possess them. Feel the distinction they create. <p>Dia (Çap:): 12 in. (30 cm) <p>Shipped in a velvet box. (Kadife Kutuda g&#337~nderilmektedir.) <p>Price includes shipping fee, delivered right to your door. (Kap&#305~n&#305~za kadar teslim masraf&#305~ fiyat&#305~miza dahildir.) ;CUSTOM-MADE;50;359.00;329.00;images/product/Tura-T.jpg;images/product/Tura-Q.jpg;images/product/Tura-Z.jpg;Others (Digerleri);Ceramics (Seramik);Plates (Tabaklar)-30 cm;;New;;;;0.00;0;0;0;;
1252;Books-Turkish (Kitaplar-Türkçe): Kanseri Beslenerek Yenebilirsiniz-Aysun & Murat Gökçen;Author (Yazar): Aysun & Murat Gokcen (Aysun & Murat Gökçen) <p>Type (Konu): Family & Health (Aile & Saglik) <p>ISBN: 975-14-0979-9 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Kanseri Beslenerek Yenebilirsiniz (Kanseri Beslenerek Yenebilirsiniz) <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 118 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 13.5x19.7cm~ 2.Hamur<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Remzi Kitabevi <p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): May (Mayis) 2004<p>Description (Aciklamalar): Kanser türlerinin yakla&#351~&#305~k % 70'i diyet-beslenme, egzersiz ve di&#287~er ya&#351~am tarz&#305~ al&#305~&#351~kanl&#305~klar&#305~yla önlenebilmektedir. Yeterli ve dengeli beslenme yoluyla güçlenen ba&#287~&#305~&#351~&#305~kl&#305~k sistemi, kanserle&#351~meye yönelen hücreleri daha kolay te&#351~his ve imha etmektedir. 1272;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Fundamentals of Electric Circuits-Alexander-Sadiku-2nd Int'l Ed;Author (Yazar): Chalres K. Alexander & Matthew N.O. Sadiku<p>Type (Konu): Course Books (Akademik)<p>ISBN: 0071151265<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Fundamentals of Electric Circuits<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 960<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 1.47 x 10.46 x 8.28 Dimensions in inches. <p>Publisher (Matbaa): McGraw-Hill<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Jan.(Ocak) 2003 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): This text is for use on the introductory circuit analysis or circuit theory course which is taught in electrical engineering departments. It includes pedagogical aids which reinforce the concepts learned so that students can become familiar with the methods of analysis presented. <p>Long Description This text is for use on the introductory circuit analysis or circuit theory course which is taught in electrical engineering departments. It includes pedagogical aids which reinforce the concepts learned so that students can become familiar with the methods of analysis presented. PSpice for Windows is a student-friendly tool introduced to students early in the text and used throughout, with discussions and examples at the end of each appropriate chapter. Each illustrative example is immediately followed by a practice problem and answer. Students follow the example step-by-step to solve the practice problem without the hassle of flipping pages or searching the end of the book for answers. Review questions at the end of each chapter are multiple choice, designed to get at the little tricks which the examples and homework problems may not cover. <p>Fundamentals of Electric Circuits, 2e is intended for use in the introductory circuit analysis or circuit theory course taught in electrical engineering or electrical engineering technology departments. The main objective of this book is to present circuit analysis in a clear, easy-to-understand manner, with many practical applications to interest the student. Each chapter opens with either historical sketches or career information on a subdiscipline of electrical engineering. This is followed by an introduction that includes chapter objectives. Each chapter closes with a summary of the key points and formulas. The authors present principles in an appealing and lucid step-by-step manner, carefully explaining each step. Important formulas are highlighted to help students sort out what is essential and what is not. Many pedagogical aids reinforce the concepts learned in the text so that students get comfortable with the various methods of analysis presented in the text. <p>KEY FEATURES: More than 200 fully worked examples, solved using a consistent problem-solving methodology. Examples are given at the end of every section. Some of the problems are solved in two or three different ways to promote an understanding and comparison of different approaches. <p>A Practice Problem with an answer follows each Example problem, so that students can test their understanding before moving to the next section. This gives students an immediate opportunity to practice the solution methods without flipping pages or looking to the end of the book for the correct answer. <p>The last section in each chapter is devoted to an application aspect of the material covered in the chapter. One or two practical devices or problems are discussed, helping students to see the real-world context of the material in the chapter. <p>The use of PSpice is introduced early and encouraged throughout the book. Additionally, an appendix serves as a tutorial for using PSpice. The appendix has been updated for the second edition. <p>Review questions are provided at the end of each chapter. The questions are multiple choice ones, designed to get at the little tricks which the examples and homework problems may not cover. <p>The last section in each chapter is devoted to an APPLICATION of the concepts covered in the chapter. These application sections help the student to see how the concepts are found in and applied to real life situations. <p>Problem-solving is discussed in chapter one to promote sound, step-by step problem solving practices. A book mark is included with each copy of the book to remind students of the solution steps (and to mark their place). <p>A new chapter (Chapter 16) has been added to augment Chapter 15 on Laplace Transforms. It covers applications of the Laplace Transform, and includes information on how MATLAB can be used to numerically perform the operations presented in chapters 15 and 16. <p>A new appendix (Appendix E) has been added to provide a tutorial on MATLAB and encourage its usage in circuit analysis. Appendix D on PSpice has been upgraded. <p>Several pedagogical aids are employed to reinforce concepts: important formulas are boxed, key terms are defined and highlighted, and marginal notes are used for warnings, hints, cross-references, problem solving insights and more. Marginal icons are also used for emphasis. <p>The CD-ROM from the first edition has been upgraded to included the following: MultSIM 2001 Student Edition and 100 circuit files from the book are presented in Electronics Workbench. <p>The Problem Solving Made Almost Easy workbook is for sale to students who wish to practice their problem solving techniques. The workbook contains a discussion of problem solving strategies and 150 additional problems with complete solutions provided. <p>The first edition Online Learning Center, which provides material for students and instructors, has been upgraded to include the following: updated solutions manual for instructors only, updated and new PowerPoint slides, updated web links, Electronics Workbench circuit files, updated network analysis tutorials and other tutorials, sample pages from the companion workbook, FE Exam review questions, quizzes, learning objectives, flashcards and a more interactive test bank. <p>CONTENTS Part 1: DC Circuits 1 Basic Concepts 2 Basic Laws 3 Methods of Analysis 4 Circuit Theorems 5 Operational Amplifiers 6 Capacitors and Inductors 7 First-Order Circuits 8 Second-Order Circuits Part 2: AC Circuits 9 Sinusoids and Phasors 10 Sinusoidal Steady-State Analysis 11 AC Power Analysis 12 Three-Phase Circuits 13 Magnetically Coupled Circuits 14 Frequency Response Part 3: Advanced Circuit Analysis 15 The Laplace Transform 16 Applications of the Laplace Transform 17 The Fourier Series 18 Fourier Transform 19 Two-Port Networks Appendix A: Simultaneous Equations and Matrix Inversion Appendix B: Complex Numbers Appendix C: Mathematical Formulas Appendix D: PSPICE for Windows Appendix E: MATLAB<p>© All rights reserved. 1290;Toiletries: Birsen Tobacco Cologne-450cc (Banyo Malzemeleri: Birsen Tutun Kolonyasi-450cc);Refreshing Tobacco Cologene in a Glass Bottle (Cam &#350~i&#351~e'de Ferahlat&#305~c&#305~ T&#369~t&#369~n Kolonyas&#305~)<p>Info (Bilgi): Perfumes based on alcohol first appeared in Ottoman Turkey during the early years of the reign of Sultan Abdülhamid II (1876-1909). Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. You are likely to be offered cologne not only in homes, but on intercity buses, whose passengers are looked upon as guests. When visiting someone who is ill or buying souvenirs for friends during a visit to another part of the country, a bottle of cologne is one of the most acceptable gifts. <p>Weight (Agirlik): 15 fl. oz. (Cam &#350~i&#351~e içinde Ferahlat&#305~c&#305~ G&#369~lsuyu.)There was already a long-standing Ottoman tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. Rose Water (G&#369~l suyu), which is prepared from roses, could be served as as drink or in a dessert such as Gullac. Because its taste is so close to the sweet smell of the actual rose some people find it difficult to drink or even eat in its jam form or with just plain cold milk or water. This is truly a Turkish product to try.Weight (Agirlik) 13 fl. oz. 1304;Toiletries: Duru Lemon Cologne-8.45 (Banyo Malzemeleri: Duru Limon Kolonyasi-250cc);Refreshing Lemon Cologene. (Duru'dan Ferahlat&#305~c&#305~ Limon Kolonyas&#305~) <p>Info (Bilgi): Perfumes based on alcohol first appeared in Ottoman Turkey during the early years of the reign of Sultan Abdülhamid II (1876-1909). Among the products that were imported at this time was Farina's Eau de Cologne. But soon local versions of the product were being made. In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. You are likely to be offered cologne not only in homes, but on intercity buses, whose passengers are looked upon as guests. When visiting someone who is ill or buying souvenirs for friends during a visit to another part of the country, a bottle of cologne is one of the most acceptable gifts.<p> Weight (Agirlik): 8.45 fl. oz. (250 cc.);YC-DRK030;0;8.99;7.99;images/product/Duru_Limon_Kolonyasi-T.jpg;images/product/Duru_Limon_Kolonyasi-Q.jpg;images/product/Duru_Limon_Kolonyasi-Z.jpg;Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore),Express-Toiletries (Banyo Malzemeleri);New;;;;10.00;0;0;0;1291,407,1290;

In 1882 Ahmet Faruki set up the first Ottoman perfume factory, and among other preparations became the first producer of cologne, which he marketed as kolonya. Cologne was both cheap and easy to produce, and its use quickly spread. There was already a long-standing tradition in Turkey of sprinkling rose water on the hands of guests following the initial exchange of pleasantries, and cologne as a more refreshing alternative soon took the place of rose water in the etiquette of Turkish social life. The tradition of offering cologne to guests is still alive and well in Turkey today. 1329;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): From Anatolia to Appalachia-Brent Kennedy;Author (Yazar): Brent Kennedy<p>Type (Konu): Research, History (Ara&#351~t&#305~rma, Tarih) <p>ISBN: 0865547769 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): From Anatolia to Appalachia: Turkish-American Dialogue.<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 130<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): N/A <p>Publisher (Matbaa): Mercer University Press<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Nov.(Kasim) 2003 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Turkic people have been migrating to America for many centuries, but this significant influx has been largely unrecognized. In "From Anatolia to Appalachia, Scolnick and Kennedy initiate a dialogue regarding this neglected area of American history and culture. This volume begins the communication with an essay reviewing existing evidence followed by interviews with knowledgeable persons about selected aspects of the population movements. An introduction and conclusion give focus and unity to the various elements of the dialogue. It is anticipated that this and subsequent volumes will(1) give information regarding studies of the movements of Turkic peoples to America~ (2) broaden understanding of American history and society~ (3) allow many, especially in the Southeast Atlantic region of the US, to better appreciate their background and place in American society~ (4) stimulate interest in the main subject or aspects of it, both in the US and abroad~ (5) tie together disparate aspects of the subject as well as the persons studying them~ and(6) add to the general knowledge regarding migrations of peoples over many centuries. In sum, this dialogue intends not only to inform and interest others, but also to pull together available research on the subject and stimulate new research in this and related areas of study. <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 1420;Books-Turkish (Kitaplar-Türkçe): Ne Demek &#304~stanbul~ Bebek, Niye Bebek!?-Onder Senyapili;Author (Yazar): Onder Senyapili (Önder &#350~enyapili) <p>Type (Konu): Research (Ara&#351~t&#305~rma)<p>ISBN: 9757064599<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Ne Demek Istanbul Bebek, Niye Bebek!? (Ne Demek &#304~stanbul~ Bebek, Niye Bebek!?) <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 165 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 3. hamur<p>Publisher (Matbaa): ODTÜ Gelistirme Vakfi<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Dec. (Aralik) 2002 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Bizanslilar, kentlerinden söz ederken Bizans demezler de, "he polis" derlermis. Polis, Yunancada kent, site anlamina geliyor. Be, belli, bilinen bir kentten söz edildigini vurguluyor. Hani, simdi Istanbul'da The Marmara var ya, Marmara Denizi'ni degil de belli bir konaklama yurdunu anlatiyor oradaki 'the'~ 'he' de 'the' gibi ayni görevi üstlenmis. Öte yandan, Yunanlilar olsun, Romalilar olsun Bizans kenti, Bizans diyari anlamina Byzantium adiyla anmislar bu yerlesimi. Ama ne zaman ki, yeni Roma kurulmus, kurucusu Büyük Konstantin yeni imparatorlugun baskenti olarak ilan etmis burasini, Isa'dan önce 330'dan itibaren Konstantinopolis, yani Konstantin kenti diye de anilmaya baslanmis.Pekiyi, ya 1930 yilinda resmi ad olarak benimsenen Istanbul adi ne zamandan beri kullaniliyor ve ne anlama geliyor? Yaniti kesinlikle verilemiyor. Tartismali... Osmanli belgelerinde ve paralarinda bir ara Istanmbol adi görülmüs. Yani, bu kentte bol sayida Islam bulundugu için bu ad verilmis gibi. Gelgelelim, Istambol'un nasil olup da Istanbul'a dönüstügünü açiklamak zor. Oysa, "eis ten polin"in Istanbul'a dönüsmesi hem daha kolay, hem de akla yatkin. <p>© All rights reserved. Büyücü Magripli, kum tepsisine bakarak Alaaddinin yeralt&#305~ndan kurtulu&#351~unu görmesi bize fantazi gelebilir. Ancak bir dü&#287~meye basmakla dünyan&#305~n herhangi bir yerini izlememiz, insano&#287~lunun geni&#351~ hayal gücünün neleri ba&#351~arabildi&#287~ine küçük bir örnek de&#287~il midir? <p>Size sunulan bu eserleri, çocuklar&#305~m&#305~z&#305~n hayal gücünü geli&#351~tirmesi bak&#305~m&#305~ndan önemli buluyoruz. Kald&#305~ ki "Binbir Gece Masallar&#305~" bütün dünya edebiyat&#305~n&#305~ etkilemi&#351~, büyük yazarlara esin kayna&#287~&#305~ olmu&#351~, hatta bu masallar&#305~ kendi geleneklerine göre yorumlayarak "Bat&#305~ Klâsikleri" diye bildi&#287~imiz birçok eser meydana getirmi&#351~lerdir. Örne&#287~in sihirli saks&#305~ya sahip olan yün e&#287~irici fakir k&#305~z, bat&#305~da "Kül Kedisi Sindirella" olarak kar&#351~&#305~m&#305~za ç&#305~k&#305~yor. Gemici Simbat&#305~n ba&#351~&#305~na gelenler sanki Robinson Crusoein &#305~ss&#305~z adas&#305~nda geçiyor... Ya da Walt Disneyin "Dostumuz Atom" adl&#305~ çizgi filmi, "Bal&#305~kç&#305~ ile &#304~frit" masal&#305~n&#305~ anlat&#305~yor bize. <p>Dünya edebiyat&#305~n&#305~, müzi&#287~ini, sinemas&#305~n&#305~, tiyatrosunu ve operas&#305~n&#305~ etkilemi&#351~, onlara malzeme olmu&#351~ do&#287~unun bu e&#351~siz eserini çocuklar&#305~m&#305~za, onlar&#305~n seviyesinde sunmaktan mutluyuz. <p>Binbir Gece Masallar&#305~n&#305~n sürükleyici, etkileyici ve merak uyand&#305~r&#305~c&#305~ serüvenlerininin çocuklar&#305~m&#305~za okuma al&#305~&#351~kanl&#305~&#287~&#305~ kazand&#305~raca&#287~&#305~n&#305~ umuyoruz. <p>Sara Gürbüz Özeren, E&#287~itimci-Yazar <p>© All rights reserved. 1394;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Classical Turkish Cooking-Ayla Esen Algar;Author (Yazar): Ayla Esen Algar<p>Type (Konu): Cookbooks (Yemek Kitaplari) <p>ISBN: 0060931639<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Classical Turkish Cooking: Traditional Turkish Food for the American Kitchen <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 306<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A<p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): N/A <p>Publisher (Matbaa): Quill/Harper<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Sept.(Eylül) 1999<p>Description (Aciklamalar): Turkish food ranks high among the world's great cuisines. Its taste and depth place it with French and Chinese~ its simplicity and healthfulness rank it number one. Developed by Turkish peasants for whom eating was obviously a great pleasure, Turkish cooking evolved to include the sophisticated "palace" cooking of Istanbul. It remains, however, a simple cuisine based on fragrant Mediterranean ingredients combined in exciting and unexpected ways.  Turkish-born Ayla Algar offers 175 recipes for this vibrant and tasty food, presented against the rich and fascinating backdrop of Turkish history and culture. Tempting recipes for kebabs, pilafs, "meze" (appetizers), dolmas-stuffed vegetables or vine leaves), soups, fish, "manti" and other pasta dishes, lamb, poultry, yogurt, bread, and traditional sweets such as baklava are introduced here to American cooks in accessible form. With its emphasis on grains, vegetables, fruits, olive oil, and other healthful foods, Turkish cooking puts a new spin on familiar ingredients and offers culinary adventure coupled with satisfying and delicious meals.<p>© All rights reserved. 1424;Turkish Delight: Divan Turkish Delight-Hazelnut-Traditional-8.8oz.Special (Turk Lokumu:Divan Lokum-;D&#304~VAN CREATES DIVINE TURKISH DELIGHT " BEST HAZELNUT TURKISH DELIGHT". The term "Turkish Delight" conjures all kinds of exotic images. At Divan, however, the exotic is the norm. History of Turkish delight dates back to 500 years ~ making Turkish Delight one of the oldest sweets in the world. Legend has it that in his endeavour to cope with all his wives, Sultan summoned all his confectionery experts and ordered them to produce a unique dessert to add to the collection of secret recipes for which he was famous. As a result of extensive research "Lokum" better known as "Turkish Delight" throughout the world was born. The sultan found it so tasty and stimulating that he and all successive Sultans always insisted on a plate of Turkish Delight with their daily feasts. The quality and taste of Turkish Delight became traditional and famous over hundreds of years and is now available for your enjoyment in its original recipe. These gummy, sugar brushed cubes can be filled with anything from fruit flavoring to pistachios, and have been a part of Turkish culture for centuries. Fashionable ladies gave Turkish Delight to friends in lace handkerchiefs, and Turkish families always serve lokum on holidays and birthdays. Since it remains fresh for one year, stored at room temperature, most households keep some on hand.It is said that Picasso used to eat Turkish Delight on daily basis for concentration on his work while Winston Churchill and Napoleon's favorite was pistachio filling.<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Water, Hazelnut, Corn Starch, Citric Acid-E330, Vanilla. (Seker, Su, Findik, Misir Nisastasi, Vanilin Aromasi.) <p>Type (Cesidi): Hazelnut-Traditional Cut. (Findikli-Buyuk Kesim.) <p> Weight (Agirlik): 8.8 oz. 1425;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): The Turks Today-Andrew Mango;Author (Yazar): Andrew Mango<p>Type (Konu): Research (Ara&#351~t&#305~rma)<p>ISBN: 1585676152 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): The Turks Today <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 292<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 9.1 x 6.5 x 1.1 inches<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Overlook Press<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Oct.(Ekim) 2004 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Istanbul-born, British-based Mango (Atatürk) offers an insightful, sympathetic portrait of recent Turkish history. The first third of the book discusses the growth of the Turkish state after Atatürk's death in 1938, with a fitful spread of democracy, clashes with Greece and the departure of Istanbul's Greek community. Economic and social conflict from 1960 to 1980 was subsequently "contained" by a military-driven constitution and rapprochement with Europe. A battle over the logo of the mayoralty of Ankara, the capital, illustrates the recent negotiations between Islamists and secularists. Istanbul, whose "infrastructure does not match its size," is growing as a regional base. In impoverished, traditionalist eastern Turkey, "the Third World has not been banished," though Mango argues that integration with the stateif not assimilationis the best hope for the Kurdish minority. Turkey today, Mango suggests, resembles the late modernizing countries of southern Europe in many ways. He sees potential for a fully democratic and secular state, but warns that it takes time to "implant Western institutions in non-Western soil." Though this volume lacks some of the bite and immediacy of a journalist's book like Stephen Kinzer's Crescent and Star, it emerges as a more thorough introduction to a less-known but increasingly vital country. <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 1434;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Poems of Nazim Hikmet-Nazim Hikmet;Author (Yazar): Nazim Hikmet<p>Type (Konu): Poetry (&#350~iir) <p>ISBN: 0892552743 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Poems of Nazim Hikmet<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 288 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): Randy Blasing, Mutlu Konuk<p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 8.2 x 5.4 x 0.7 inches<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Persea Books <p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): May (Mayis) 2002 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): A leading modern Turkish poet, Hikmet (1902-1963) once wrote from prison, "In the twentieth century / grief lasts / at most a year." First jailed in 1924 at the age of 22 for working on a leftist magazine, he spent 18 years incarcerated. Hikmet was awarded the World Peace Prize in 1950, the same year as he gained his release from jail, only to be exiled from Turkey in 1951 for the last 13 years of his life. The poet evidently never lost his faith in social justice. His love of life apparently didn't weaken, and his poems resonate with its power: "Shot through ten years of bondage like a bullet, / . . . my heart is still the same heart, my head still the same head." But to consider Hikmet a political poet only is to miss his gift, and a temperament infected with joy. In "Occupation" he writes, "In the afternoon heat I pick olives, / the leaves the loveliest of greens: / I'm light from head to toe." The translations by Blasing and Mutlu Konak convey the power and originality of the work~ there are no weak poems here. As Hikmet grew, he delivered a richness and humanity unparalleled in its freedom from bitterness in poems like "Things I Didn't Know I Loved," "After Getting Out of Prison" and "The Last Bus." <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 1449;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): The New Penguin Atlas of Medieval History-Colin McEvedy;Author (Yazar): Colin McEvedy<p>Type (Konu): Atlases, History (Atlaslar, Tarih) <p>ISBN: 0140512497 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): The New Penguin Atlas of Medieval History<p>Original Title (Orjinal Title): The New Penguin Atlas of Medieval History <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 112 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A<p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 7.1 x 8.8 x 0.3 inches<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Penguin Books<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Nov.(Kasim) 1992 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Ortaça&#287~ Tarih Atlas&#305~, &#304~S 4. yüzy&#305~l&#305~n ortalar&#305~ndan (Roma &#304~mparatorlu&#287~u'nun resmi olarak ikiye bölünmesinden az önce), &#304~S 15. yüzy&#305~l&#305~n sonlar&#305~na (ilk ke&#351~if yolculuklar&#305~) kadar uzanan tarih dilimini kaps&#305~yor. Yorumlar&#305~ Avrupa a&#287~&#305~rl&#305~kl&#305~ olmakla birlikte kitab&#305~n baz haritas&#305~, Yak&#305~ndo&#287~u'nun da tümünü içererek ortaça&#287~ dünyas&#305~n&#305~n co&#287~rafi çerçevesinin tamam&#305~n&#305~ ortaya ç&#305~kar&#305~yor. Atalay seeks the consilience of science and artpainting, architecture, sculpture, music, mathematics, physics, biology, astronomy, and engineeringand the unity of the two cultures. He delves deeply into the underlying mathematics and aesthetics of science and art, paying special attention to the mathematical sequence called the Fibonacci series and to the related notion of the "golden ratio" or "divine proportion"the keys to understanding the unity of art and nature. 32 b/w and 16 color illustrations. <p>© All rights reserved. 1516;Beverages: Yayla Ayran - Yoghurt Drink (Mesrubatlar: Yayla Ayran);Tasteful yoghurt drink from Yayla. (Yayla'dan nefis ayran.)<p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Pasteurized Milk, Pectin, Salt, Active Culture. (Pastorize Sut, Pektin, Tuz, Active Kultur.)<p>Info(Bilgi): Ayran has been one of the most popular drinks of the Turks since the discovery of Yogurt among the Turkish tribes in Central Asia. It is simply made by diluting yogurt with water. Some salt is added to taste. It not only accompanies any meal but is drunk as a refreshing drink by itself. It is common among all regions of the country only the slight variation being its thickness.<p>Nutirition Facts per Serving (Besin Ogeleri):<p> Calories (Enerji): 110 kcal.  <p>Total Fat (Toplam Ya&#287~): 10 g. <p> Saturated Fat (Doymu&#351~ Ya&#287~): 6 g. <p>Chollesterol (Kolesterol): 40 mg. <p>Sodium (Sodyum): 600 mg. <p>Total Carbohydrate (Toplam Karbonhidrat): 2 g <p>Dietary Fiber (Diyet Lifi): 0 g. <p>Sugar (&#350~eker): 2 g. <p>Protein (Protein): 3 g.  <p>Weight (Agirlik): 1.06 lbs. 1609;Ornaments: Wall Evil Eye Charm-Piramid (Sus: Duvar Nazar Boncugu-Piramit);The force of the evil eye (or Nazar) is a widely accepted and feared random element in Turkish daily life. It is believed that the "Evil Eye" charm would protect the one from evil. (Nazar'in gucu Turk hayatinda onemli bir rol oynar.  Bu nedenle "Nazar bonucugu"'nun kotuluklerden koruduguna inanilir.)<p>This charm can be found all over Turkey and some other Eastern Mediterranean cultures. It can be found in bracelets, earrings, necklaces and in other types of home decoration. (Bu tilsim Turkiye ve bazi dogu Akdeniz kulturlerinde yaygindir. Kolye, yuzuk, kupe ve diger ev dekorasyonlarinda gorulebilir.) <p>This original wall Turkish evil eye charm can be used as decoration anywere you wish to hang it. Tan&#305~d&#305~&#287~&#305~m insanlard&#305~ hepsi ~ içlerinde benden ve sevdiklerimden parçalar vard&#305~. iyi anla&#351~aklar&#305~n&#305~ umuyordum ba&#351~lang&#305~çta ~ ne var ki onlar&#305~ olu&#351~turan çizgiler netle&#351~tikçe, umdu&#287~um gibi geçimli olamayacklar&#305~n&#305~ anlamak zorunda kald&#305~m. (...) Onlar&#305~n yola bak&#305~&#351~lar&#305~na, beklentilerine ya da hüzünlerine göre de&#287~i&#351~iyordu her &#351~ey. O zaman da yürüdükleri yol ayn&#305~ olmaktan ç&#305~k&#305~yor, üçü için üç ayr&#305~ gerçe&#287~e dönü&#351~üyordu. att&#305~klar&#305~ her ad&#305~m onlar&#305~ yanl&#305~zca geçmi&#351~lerinden de&#287~il birbirlerinden de uzakla&#351~t&#305~r&#305~yordu böylece. For the first time in a single, accessible volume, this book traces the Turkic peoples' trajectory from steppe, to empire, to nation-state. Cultural, economic, social, and political history unite in these pages to illuminate the projection of Turkic identity across space and time and the profound transformations marked successively by the Turks' entry into Islam and into modernity. <p>© All rights reserved. She divides her time between her job at the poultry factory, looking after two children and baking cakes for the local cafe, bearing the weight of responsibility on her shoulders. The strain on Giovanna is increased when her husband in his kindness brings home a refined elderly gentleman who has lost his memory. In trying to help this man, Giovanna reluctantly spends more and more time with him, slowly uncovering clues to the mystery of his buried past: a number tatooed onto his forearm, his expertise in the art of patisserie and the name, Simone...  Increasingly irritated by her husband's softness, her fantasies of the ideal are projected onto the handsome, mysterious neighbor opposite whom she watches in the hope of adding a little excitement to her life. <p>(Kar&#351~&#305~daki Pencere, evleri birbirine bakan genç bir çift ile geçmi&#351~i s&#305~rlarla dolu ya&#351~l&#305~ bir adam&#305~n hikayesini anlat&#305~yor.) <p>© All rights reserved. 1722;Puddings: Ulker Ashure Traditional Legume Pudding (Pudingler: Ülker A&#351~ure);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Sugar, Wheat Paste, Dry Fuits- Grape-Orange-Peach, Boiled Grains-Chick Peas-Beans. (Seker, Bugday Ezmesi, Kuru Mueyveler-Uzum-Kus Uzumu- Portakal-Kayisi, On Pisirilmiz Baklagil-Nohut-Fasulye, Pirinc.)<p>Information (Bilgi): It is one of the oldest and most traditional desserts of the Turkish cuisine. 15 or more ingredients go into making "Asure" (pronounced Ashure). It is usually made and served during the religious month called "Asure Month" which follows "The Feast of Sacrifice". All religious days and holidays are observed according to the muslim calendar. During "Asure Month" the pudding is prepared in large amounts in almost every household, and offered to guests as well as to relatives and neighbors. There is a legend about the origin of this dessert. "When Noah's Ark came to rest on Mount Ararat in northeastern Turkey, it was felt that a feast of celebration was called for. But their supplies were exhausted. However, they hunted through the Ark and every little bit or food they could find, they put into the pudding and made themselves a splendid feast of Asure. (Asure'nin ilginc bir hikayesi vardir. Rivayete gore Nuh'un gemisi Agri Daginda karaya oturunca, burda kutlama yapilmasini dusunmusler. Yiyecek malzemeleri cok az kaldigi icin bolgede bulabildikleri her turlu yiyacegi yaptiklari pudinge katmislar ve guzel bir guzel bir Asure ziyafeti cekmisler.)<p>Preperation (Hazirlanisi): Pour 750 ml-4 glasses of water to a souppan and add all the contents of packet. Stir until it boils in mild heat. When it starts to boil, lower the heat and boil 20 more minutes without the lid. Once you take it out of the heat, stir occesionally for 5 minutes. Wait another 5 minutes to decorate with cinnamon, wallnuts, Palmagranite, Pistachio, Sasame, etc. Serve it cold. (750 ml.-3.5 su bardagi suyu bir tencereye bosaltin. Uzerine posetin tamamini ilave edin. Orta ateste sureli karistirarak pisirin. Kaynamaya baslayinca ocagi kisin ve tencere kapagini kapatmadan, 20 dakika daha kaynamaya birakin. Sonra ocaktan alip arada karistirarak 5 dakika sogutun. Asureyi kepce ile kaselere bosaltin. 5 dakika kadar bekledikten sonra ustunu Tarcin, Nar, Wllnuts, Pistachio, Susam, Cam Fistigi vb. malzemlerle susleyip soguk servis yapin.)<p>Serves 4-6 (4-6 kisiliktir.)<p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri): N/A<p>Weight (Agirlik): 7.76 oz. (220 gram) ;YC-ULPA100;50;2.29;1.99;images/product/Ulker_Bizim_Asure_220gr-T.jpg;images/product/Ulker_Bizim_Asure_220gr-Q.jpg;images/product/Ulker_Bizim_Asure_220gr-Z.jpg;Puddings (Pudingler);;;Express Checkout (Hizli Alisveris),By Product Category (Urun Tipine Gore),Express-Puddings (Pudingler);New;;;;2.00;0;0;0;304,648,1409;
1723;Puddings: Ulker Kazandibi (Pudingler: Ülker Kazandibi);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Powder Sugar, Corn, Starch, Rice Starch, Modified Corn Starch, Nature Identical Caramel Flavor). (Toz Seker, Piric Nisastasi, Misir Nisastasi, Modifiye Misir Nisastasi, Dogala Ozdes Karamel Aromasi.) <p>Directions (Tarifi): Pour 875 ml-4.5 glasses of cold milk to a cup and add all the contents of packet. Stir until it boils in mild heat. When it starts to boil, continue for 3-4 minutes. Butter a seel or Aluminium pan with margarine and sprinkle two table spoons of granulated sugar and add the earlier contents to this pan. Cook this in high heat approximately 5-10 minutes or till the edges are brown. Remove from the heat and let it wait in room temperature for a while and place it to your fridge for a couple of hours. Serve it Cold.(875 ml.-4.5 su bardagi soguk sutu bir tencereye bosaltin. Uzerine posetin tamamini ilave edin. Orta ateste sureli karistirarak pisirin. Kaynamaya baslayinca 3-4 dakika daha pisirmeye devam edin. Alaminyum veya Celik tepsiyi findik buyklugunde margarin ile yaglayin. Dibine 2 yemek kasigi toz seker serpin ve pisirdiginiz tatliyi dokun. Kuvvetli ates uzerinde kenarlari kizarincaya kadar, yaklasik 5-10 dakika gezdirin. Oda sicakligina geldikten sonra buzdalabina birkac saat bekletin. Soguk Servis Yapin.) <p>Serves 4-6. (4-6 Kisiliktir.) <p>Nutrition Facts per Serving (Besin &#336~&#287~eleri): N/A<p>Weight (Agirlik): 5.2 oz. 1739;Gift: Pasabahce Charm No. 2 (Hediyelik: Pa&#351~abahçe Nazarlik No. 2);The force of the evil eye (or Nazar) is a widely accepted and feared random element in Turkish daily life. It is believed that the "Evil Eye" charm would protect the one from evil. (Nazar'in gucu Turk hayatinda onemli bir rol oynar. Bu nedenle "Nazar bonucugu"'nun kotuluklerden koruduguna inanilir.) <p>This charm can be found all over Turkey and some other Eastern Mediterranean cultures. It can be found in bracelets, earrings, necklaces and in other types of home decoration. (Bu tilsim Turkiye ve bazi dogu Akdeniz kulturlerinde yaygindir. Kolye, yuzuk, kupe ve diger ev dekorasyonlarinda gorulebilir.) This original wall Turkish evil eye charm can be used as decoration anywere you wish to hang it. 1792;Gifts: Soganli Small Doll (Hediyelik: So&#287~anl&#305~ Bebek Küçük);Info (Bilgi): In Central Anotolia, a doll made by an old woman from tree branches wrapped in colorful clothes for her granddaughter strikes a Tourists eye. This old aged tradition is introduced to the world by pure coincidence. (Ya&#351~l&#305~ bir ninenin köyde torunu için bir a&#287~aç parças&#305~n&#305~n üzerine evdeki kuma&#351~lar&#305~ sararak yapt&#305~&#287~&#305~ bebek bir turistin ilgisini çeker ve onu sat&#305~n al&#305~r. Bu olaydan sonra geleneksel motiflerle bezeli kuma&#351~lar ve a&#287~aç parçalar&#305~yla üretilen So&#287~anl&#305~ Bebekleri giderek bir sektör haline dönü&#351~ür So&#287~anl&#305~ Köyü'nde.)<p>These dolls are handmade. (Bu bebekler el yap&#305~m&#305~d&#305~r.) <p>Approximate Height (Yaklasik Boyu): 9.05 in. (23 cm.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 1793;Gifts: Testili Small Doll (Hediyelik: Testili Bebek Küçük);Info (Bilgi): In Central Anotolia, a doll made by an old woman from tree branches wrapped in colorful clothes for her granddaughter strikes a Tourists eye. This old aged tradition is introduced to the world by pure coincidence. (Ya&#351~l&#305~ bir ninenin köyde torunu için bir a&#287~aç parças&#305~n&#305~n üzerine evdeki kuma&#351~lar&#305~ sararak yapt&#305~&#287~&#305~ bebek bir turistin ilgisini çeker ve onu sat&#305~n al&#305~r. 1808;Gift: Pasabahce Braided Charm No. 0 (Hediyelik: Pa&#351~abahçe Makrome Nazarlik No. 0);The force of the evil eye (or Nazar) is a widely accepted and feared random element in Turkish daily life. It is believed that the "Evil Eye" charm would protect the one from evil. (Nazar'in gucu Turk hayatinda onemli bir rol oynar. Bu nedenle "Nazar bonucugu"'nun kotuluklerden koruduguna inanilir.) <p>This charm can be found all over Turkey and some other Eastern Mediterranean cultures. It can be found in bracelets, earrings, necklaces and in other types of home decoration. (Bu tilsim Turkiye ve bazi dogu Akdeniz kulturlerinde yaygindir. Kolye, yuzuk, kupe ve diger ev dekorasyonlarinda gorulebilir.) <p>This original wall Turkish evil eye charm can be used as decoration anywere you wish to hang it. (Bu orjinal duvar nazar boncugu asmak istediginiz her yerde dekorasyon olarak kullanilir.) <p>Dimentions (Çap): 1.18 in. (3 cm.) <p>Type (Tipi): Glass & Makrome Thread (Cam & Makrom Ipi)<p>Hand-Knitted with Makrome thread. 1809;Gift: Pasabahce Braided Charm No. 1 (Hediyelik: Pa&#351~abahçe Makrome Nazarlik No. 1);The force of the evil eye (or Nazar) is a widely accepted and feared random element in Turkish daily life. It is believed that the "Evil Eye" charm would protect the one from evil. (Nazar'in gücü Türk hayatinda önemli bir rol oynar. Bu nedenle "Nazar bonucugu"'nun kötüluklerden koruduguna inanilir.) <p>This charm can be found all over Turkey and some other Eastern Mediterranean cultures. It can be found in bracelets, earrings, necklaces and in other types of home decoration. (Bu tilsim Turkiye ve bazi dogu Akdeniz kültürlerinde yaygindir. Kolye, yüzuk, küpe ve diger ev dekorasyonlarinda görülebilir.) <p>This original wall Turkish evil eye charm can be used as decoration anywere you wish to hang it. (Eylül) 2005 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Turkey is a country in a state of flux, swept along by an extraordinary process of change. In the last few years a series of far-reaching political and economic reforms has swept away much of the old order which ruled the country for so long. Some people call it a second Turkish revolution. But resistance to reform remains strong. Pressure for change has come from ordinary people fed up with the old ways~ it's also been motivated by the dominant issue of Turkish political life - the long pursuit of membership of the European Union. And yet Turkey remains a mystery to many outsiders~ a complex country hard to understand. It's secular and Muslim, Western and Eastern, democratic and authoritarian, all at the same time. This book examines the potential and the problems of the new Turkey, and the expectations of the people who live there, drawing on first hand interviews and observations gathered over several years. <p>© All rights reserved. 1871;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Jem Sultan-John Freely;Author(Yazar): John Freely<p>Type (Konu): History, Research, Politics (Tarih, Arast&#305~rma, Politika) <p>ISBN: 0007150660 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Jem Sultan-The Adventures of a Captive Turkish Prince in Renaissance Europe<p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 352<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#287~i): Hardcover<p>Publisher (Matbaa): HarperCollins Publishers<p>Publishing Date (Bas&#305~m Tarihi): Jul. (Temmuz) 2004<p>Description (Aciklamalar): The story of Jem Sultan is one of the most colourful in Turkish history. The son of Mehmet the Conqueror, he lost out to his brother Beyazit in the struggle to become sultan, and he was sent into exile, first in Rhodes, and later in southern France and Rome. He became a diplomatic pawn, caught between the rival aspirations of emperors, popes and kings. He died in 1495, probably poisoned by Pope Alexander Borgia, and his body was conveyed to Bursa. Jems memory is perpetuated in the folklore and poetry of Turkey. But while he lived in continental Europe for much of his life, his story is surprisingly little-known outside his native land. John Freelys book will rectify this, and will bring Jem back to life in the same way that THE LOST MESSIAH brought Sabbetai Sevi to life.<p>© All rights reserved. 1881;Beverages: Aksu Vidal Tyme Water (Mesrubatlar: Aksu Vidal Kekik Suyu);Ingredients (Icindekiler): Several types of Tyme, Water, Timol, Carvacrol, Borneol, Cymol, Linalol, Pinan and Flovon. (Bircok cesit kekik, Su, Timol, Carvacrol, Borneol, Cymol, Linalol, Pinan and Flovon.)<p>Thyme is used in the recovery of stomach and intestine gases and treatment of poor digestion bound to its volatile oily composition. As it also accelerates the burning of fats in the body, has cholesterol decreasing effect and by speeding up the metabolism assists you in losing weight. Thyme, being a very good expectorant, gives support in the treatment of asthma, bronchitis and croup. Accelerates blood circulation and diminishes spasm pains. It is used as gargle in tooth infections, mouth and throat wounds. In diabetic cases, drops down the blood sugar and helps the control of tension. AKSUVITAL, presents Thyme Water provided through distillation of water vapour from the blooming branches of Thymus and Origenon types under hygienic conditions in 100% natural form and as concentration, and in sanitary glass packing. AKSU V&#304~TAL, about 40 types of Thyme are grown in Turkey. All the types are used for treatment. Mostly Origanum types are used for treatment in our country. <p>ADVANTAGES OF THYME WATER<br> 1 - Help to lose weight by accelerating burning of fats in the body, <br>2 - In diabetic cases, helps in dropping down the level of blood sugar <br>3 - Accelerates blood circulation, eases spasm, and may also be used as urinative and intestine parasiticide. <br>4 - Regulates the functions of digestion system, recovers intestine gases, and eases digestion. <br>5 - It is an expectorant. Used in asthma, bronchitis and cold illnesses, as well as in the treatment of croup coughing. <br>6 - It has characteristics as pain reliever and relaxer. <br>7 - It can be used as gargle in tooth infections, mouth and throat wounds. <br>8 - Drops down cholesterol. <br>9 - Controls hypertension. <br><p>HOW TO USE <br> Thyme water is used either as a drink or gargle. Drinking: AKSU VITAL PURE THYME WATER may be drunk easily by mixing it with honey, water or fruit juices. (When it is used in the treatment of diabetic illnesses, it should not be mixed with sweet drinks.<br>Gargle: Gargle your mouth with PURE THYME WATER, and then spit it.<br>Usage Method: AKSU VITAL PURE THYME WATER is presented to you in concentrated form to be economical. You can increase the amount of the thyme water by thinning it with other liquids at the specified portion. For the thinning of thyme water, pour pure and concentrated thyme water, 14 of a glass, in a tea glass and fill it with water. <p>Daily Dosage: AKSU VITAL PURE THYME WATER is drunk cold after meals, in fullness, after being thinned in one tea-glass of liquid. Do not boil AKSU PURE THYME WATER presented in a glass packing as it may lose volatile oil content. It is indicated by the experts that it has no side effects in case of utilisation according to the recommended dosage. On the other hand, Thyme water, is not recommended for those suffering from gastric and duodenal ulcer. Avicenna Manna With Honey, Friend Of Your Stomach, is recommendable.<p>(Türkiyede yakla&#351~&#305~k 40 çe&#351~it kekik türü yeti&#351~mektedir. 1950;DVD: The Small Town (Kasaba);Movie Title (Film Ad&#305~): The Town (Kasaba) <p>Director (Direktör): Nuri Bilge Ceylan<p>Filmed by (Yapim Firmas&#305~): Klasik Film Kampanyas&#305~<p>Release Date (Vizyon Tarhi): 1997<p>Awards (Ödüller): 17. Istanbul Film Festivali, 1998 - Fipresci Ödülü<p>Actors (Aktör ve Aktristler): Fatma Ceylan, Mehmet Emin Ceylan, Mehmet Emin Toprak<p>Length (Süresi): 82 Minutes <p>Rating (Reyting): PG-13 <p>Language (Dil): Turkish (Türkçe) <p>Dubbed in (Dublaj): Turkish (Türkçe) <p>Subtitles (Altyaz&#305~): German, French, English (Almanca, Frans&#305~zca, Ingilizce) <p>Synopsis (Film Hakk&#305~nda):  depiction of a small Turkish town, as seen from the perspective of an 11 year old girl and her 7 year - old brother. The four part film unfolds along with the seasons. The first part is set at the school the girl attends, the social environment she must adapt to and its difficulties. She faces with her feeling of shame and some merciless clues of life. The second part is in spring. We see the girl with her brother and their journey to the maize field where their family are waiting for them. As they pass through the countryside, they encounter the mysteries of nature and wildlife. The childhood cruelty of the spring scenes flows into a summer evening when the children with their parents, grandparents and a cousin are roasting maize by a fire. Here the brother and sister witness the complexities and darkness of the adult world. The adults conversation, that is about war, death, poverty, hunger, work and reputation, reveal all kinds of things about the family. The fourth part takes place at home. This is a tranquil sequence moving between reality and dream. (Kasaba, tipik bir Anadolu kasabas&#305~nda ya&#351~ayan ve üç ku&#351~a&#287~&#305~ bünyesinde bar&#305~nd&#305~ran bir ailenin hayat&#305~n&#305~ çocuklar&#305~n gözlerinden anlatan bir film. Ilk bölüm, bir k&#305~&#351~ günü, ailenin 11 ya&#351~&#305~ndaki k&#305~z&#305~n&#305~n okudu&#287~u ve onun toplumsalla&#351~ma s&#305~k&#305~nt&#305~lar&#305~n&#305~ ve çevresindeki hayat&#305~n birtak&#305~m sosyolojik özellikleriyle tan&#305~&#351~mas&#305~n&#305~ sa&#287~layan bir ilkokul s&#305~n&#305~f&#305~nda geçer. Ikinci bölüm, okuldan ç&#305~kan k&#305~z&#305~n, kendisinden dört ya&#351~ küçük erkek karde&#351~ini de yan&#305~na alarak, tabiat&#305~n ve hayvanlar dünyas&#305~n&#305~n gizemleriyle yüzyüze gelmelerine neden olan bir yolculukla, kasaban&#305~n d&#305~&#351~&#305~ndaki ve ailelerinin kendilerini beklemekte oldu&#287~u m&#305~s&#305~r tarlas&#305~na kadar olan yolculuklar&#305~n&#305~ anlat&#305~yor. Üçüncü bölümde, o ana kadar birbirlerinin, do&#287~an&#305~n ve hayvanlar dünyas&#305~n&#305~n gizemleriyle yüzyüze kalm&#305~&#351~ olan iki karde&#351~, büyükler dünyas&#305~n&#305~n karanl&#305~&#287~&#305~na ve karma&#351~as&#305~na tan&#305~k olmak durumunda kal&#305~rlar. Ilerleyen gece içerisinde çocuklar uyku ile uyan&#305~kl&#305~k aras&#305~ bir bak&#305~&#351~la ate&#351~in etraf&#305~na oturmu&#351~ ve her biri ba&#351~ka bir &#351~eyi temsil eden büyükler dünyas&#305~n&#305~n çat&#305~&#351~an, çeli&#351~en, zaman zaman sertle&#351~en, bazen &#351~efkate dönü&#351~en ve yumu&#351~ayan gizemli dünyas&#305~na tan&#305~kl&#305~k ederler...)<p>© All rights reserved. 1985;Books-Turkish (Kitaplar-Türkçe): Yeni Binyilda is Basarisinin 12 Anahtari-Acar Baltas;Author (Yazar): Prof. Dr. Acar Baltas(Prof. Dr. Acar Balta&#351~)<p>Type (Konu): Business & Management (&#304~s ve Yönetim) <p>ISBN: 975140887-3<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Yeni Binyilda is Basarisinin 12 Anahtari (Yeni Biny&#305~lda i&#351~ Ba&#351~ar&#305~s&#305~n&#305~n 12 Anahtar&#305~)<p>Original Title (Orjinal Adi): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Sayisi): 48 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#287~i): 15 x 23 cm., 1. hamur<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Remzi Kitabevi<p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Sept. (Eylul) 2002<p>Description (Aciklamalar): Günümüzde &#351~irketlerin kar&#351~&#305~s&#305~ndaki en büyük zorluk, de&#287~i&#351~im h&#305~z&#305~na ayak uydurmakt&#305~r. &#305~&#351~ dünyas&#305~nda artan rekabet, çal&#305~&#351~anlar üzerindeki bask&#305~y&#305~ art&#305~r&#305~yor. Çal&#305~&#351~anlar i&#351~yerlerinde daha uzun saatler geçirmek ve daha verimli olmak için enerjilerinin bütününü tüketmek zorunda. Böyle bir dünyada yeni çözümlere ihtiyaç var. Eskiden yapt&#305~klar&#305~m&#305~z&#305~ tekrarlayarak ba&#351~ar&#305~l&#305~ olamayaca&#287~&#305~m&#305~z bir dünya bu. 1995;Soups: 5-Piyale Chicken Noodle Soup (Corbalar: 5-Adet Piyale Sehriyeli Tavuk Corbasi);Directions (Tarifi): Add 5 glasses of cold water to a cup with the soup. Stir until it boils. Simmer for 10 minutes. Your soup is ready to eat, Bona-petit! (5 bardak soguk suyu bir tencereye koyunuz. Kaynayincaya kadar karistiriniz. Kisik ateste karistirarak 10 dakika pisiriniz. Baz&#305~ rüyalar&#305~n görülen &#351~ekliyle uyand&#305~ktan sonra ya&#351~ananlar aras&#305~nda birebir ili&#351~ki olabilir. Mesela rüyan&#305~zda &#351~i&#351~manlad&#305~&#287~&#305~n&#305~z&#305~ görürsünüz ve bu rüyay&#305~ gördükten sonra h&#305~zla kilo almaya ba&#351~lars&#305~n&#305~z. Biz bu tür rüyalara "Varso rüyalar" diyoruz. Yani rüyan&#305~zda ne "varsa", sonras&#305~nda da onlar ya&#351~an&#305~yor. Baz&#305~ rüyalar ise tam tersiyle tecelli eder. Mesela rüyan&#305~zda son derece kibar ve nazik bir hareketle kar&#351~&#305~la&#351~&#305~rs&#305~n&#305~z, oysa bu, üç vakte kadar kaba ve hoyrat hareketlerle sars&#305~laca&#287~&#305~n&#305~z anlam&#305~na gelir. Rüyada görülenlerin tersinin ç&#305~kt&#305~&#287~&#305~ bu tür rüyalara da "Terso rüyalar" diyoruz.  Baz&#305~ rüyalar da vard&#305~r ki, ne görülen halinden ne de tersinden hareket ederek herhangi bir do&#287~ru yoruma ula&#351~mak mümkündür. Bu tür rüyalar&#305~ ancak ve ancak bu i&#351~in üstatlar&#305~n&#305~n söyledikleriyle ve as&#305~rlara varan tecrübelerden yola ç&#305~karak yorumlayabiliriz. (Ekim) 2005 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): I returned home after a long journey to find a black cloud hanging over the city, but it was an unspoken rule for the inhabitants never to discuss evil happenings. If something was going wrong, everyone waited patiently until the evil ended before talking about it. So in this city where there were at most three murders a year, to hear of serial murder ­ moreover of messenger boy murder ­ was no trifling matter. Unwillingly charged with investigating mysterious deaths among the city¹s fleet of seemingly perfect, ageless messenger boys, Stavrogin encounters the city¹s strange and charismatic characters, and its even stranger secret ­ a program of genetic engineering. From a popular and innovative Turkish author, The Messenger Boy Murders is a darkly comic, irreverent and hypnotic tale, an exploration of humanity's endless absurdity and its futile attempts to create perfection, cleverly wrapped in a murder mystery.<p> (Her &#351~eyi sessizli&#287~e gömen, t&#305~k&#305~r t&#305~k&#305~r i&#351~leyen bir &#351~ehir... &#350~ehrin birörnek haberci çocuklar&#305~... 2015;Prayer Beeds: T-1002  (Tesbih: T-1002 );The force of the evil eye (or Nazar) is a widely accepted and feared random element in Turkish daily life. It is believed that the "Evil Eye" charm would protect the one from evil. (Nazar'in gucu Turk hayatinda onemli bir rol oynar. Bu nedenle "Nazar bonucugu"'nun kotuluklerden koruduguna inanilir.) <p>This charm can be found all over Turkey and some other Eastern Mediterranean cultures. It can be found in bracelets, earrings, necklaces, prayer beeds and in other types of home decoration. (Bu tilsim Turkiye ve bazi dogu Akdeniz kulturlerinde yaygindir. Kolye, yuzuk, kupe, tesbih ve diger ev dekorasyonlarinda gorulebilir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. 2045;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Tales from the Expat Harem-Anastasia Ashman, Jennifer Gökmen;Author (Yazar): Anastasia M Ashman, Jennifer E Gokmen (Anastasia M Ashman, Jennifer E Gökmen) <p>Type (Konu): Memoirs, History (An&#305~, Tarih) <p>ISBN: 9752933726<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Tales from the Expat Harem: Foreign Women in Modern Turkey <p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A<p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 350<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): N/A<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Dogan Kitap Yay&#305~nlar&#305~ <p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): Oct. (Ekim) 2005 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): This is a timely anthology on being female expats in a Muslim country - and how the Turkish landscape, psyche, people, and customs have transformed their lives. As the Western world struggles to comprehend the paradoxes of modern Turkey, a country both European and Asian, forward-looking yet rooted in ancient empire, "Tales from the Expat Harem" reveals its most personal nuances. This illuminating anthology provides a window into the country from the perspective of thirty-two expatriates from seven different nations - artists, entrepreneurs, Peace Corps volunteers, archaeologists, missionaries, and others - who established lives in Turkey for work, love, or adventure. Poignant, humorous, and transcendent, the essays take readers to weddings and workplaces, down cobbled Byzantine streets, into boisterous bazaars along the Silk Road, and deep into the feminine stronghold of steamy Ottoman bathhouses. The outcome is a stunning collection of voices from women suspended between two homes as they redefine their identities and reshape their worldviews.  <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakki saklidir.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days.
