(Ocak) 2006 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): Hiçbir insan, &#304~mparator'un sahip oldu&#287~u ka­dar ölçüsüz, karma&#351~&#305~k bir güce sahip de&#287~ildi. O, birbi­rini izleyi&#351~ s&#305~ras&#305~n&#305~ sürdürdü&#287~ü Romal&#305~ Sezarlar gibi mutlak bir iktidar&#305~n sahibi, Tanr&#305~'n&#305~n kendisi tara­f&#305~ndan Kilise'nin en yüksek yol göstericisi olarak seçil­mi&#351~, Tanr&#305~'n&#305~n insanlar aras&#305~nda ve dünya üzerindeki temsilcisi, dünyevi konularda oldu&#287~u gibi, ruhani konu­larda da kanun yap&#305~c&#305~s&#305~yd&#305~. Taç giyme töreninin &#304~mparatora ba&#287~&#305~&#351~lad&#305~&#287~&#305~ karakter, onu insanlardan o dere­ce uzakla&#351~t&#305~r&#305~yordu ki gücünü Tanr&#305~'dan ba&#351~kas&#305~ndan almazm&#305~&#351~ gibi görünüyordu. Bu andan ba&#351~layarak~ ön­ceki ki&#351~ili&#287~inin ve soyunun ne hükmü olurdu? Tahta ç&#305~k&#305~&#351~, yeni bir do&#287~u&#351~tu. Senatonun seçimi, halk&#305~n ve ordu­nun onay&#305~ bir formaliteden ba&#351~ka bir &#351~ey de&#287~ildi. Vera­set bile me&#351~rulukta rol oynam&#305~yordu. Kendine taç giydirtmeyi ba&#351~ar&#305~nca~ kim olursa olsun, bir saltanat sahibi kutsal hale geliyordu. Tanr&#305~ tara­f&#305~ndan seçilmi&#351~ bulunmas&#305~ndan ötürü &#304~mparator, geçmi­&#351~inin hesab&#305~n&#305~ vermekle yükümlü de&#287~ildi. Hiçbir ad, Bizans'&#305~nki kadar itibara ve üne sahip olamam&#305~&#351~t&#305~r~ muazzam ve karmakar&#305~&#351~&#305~k facialar&#305~n birbiri ard&#305~nca daha göz al&#305~c&#305~ bir ak&#305~&#351~&#305~n&#305~ hayallerde canland&#305~racak bir ba&#351~ka ad bulunamaz.<p> Konstantin, ad&#305~n&#305~ ta&#351~&#305~yan &#351~ehrin dünyan&#305~n gözlerini kama&#351~t&#305~rmas&#305~n&#305~ istemi&#351~ti. Bunu gururunun, dehas&#305~n&#305~n, hayallerinin ölçüsünde gerçekle&#351~tirmi&#351~ti ama onu dünyan&#305~n hay­ranl&#305~&#287~&#305~na bir efsane konusu yaparken, bu parlak madalyonun öbür yüzünün kaderini de tayin etmekteydi. Hayranl&#305~k h&#305~rs haline geliyor ve onu bin y&#305~l boyunca, bütün milletlerde vah&#351~i bir ele geçir­me arzusu uyand&#305~ran av haline getiriyordu. Bi­zans için felaket olan ve &#304~mparatorun esir dü&#351~mesi ile sonuçlanan Malazgirt Meydan Sava&#351~&#305~, &#304~mparatorlu­&#287~un hayat&#305~nda bir dönüm noktas&#305~ olu&#351~turan tarihler­den biridir~ en zengin ve en güçlü Anadolu eyaletleri bundan böyle Türklere ait olmaktayd&#305~. <p>Ku&#351~atman&#305~n yakla&#351~t&#305~&#287~&#305~n&#305~n ve bütün umutlar&#305~n ortadan kalkm&#305~&#351~ bulundu&#287~unun bi­lindi&#287~i s&#305~rada, halk son bir dini ç&#305~rp&#305~n&#305~&#351~la sars&#305~lm&#305~&#351~t&#305~. Romal&#305~ bir kardinal, &#304~sidore gelerek Ayasofya'da bir­le&#351~me &#351~erefine resmi bir ayin yapm&#305~&#351~t&#305~. Bu olay, &#304~stan­bul'un ya Türk ya da Roma boyunduru&#287~una girmeye mahkum oldu&#287~unu gören Ortodokslar&#305~ çileden ç&#305~kard&#305~ ve onlarda Türkleri tercih ettiler. 29 May&#305~s 1453'te &#304~stanbul dü&#351~tü ve Osmanl&#305~ &#304~mparatorlu&#287~u Bizans'&#305~n miras&#305~n&#305~ devralarak, Do&#287~u Roma &#304~mparatorlu&#287~unun yönünü bat&#305~ya çevirdi. <p>© All rights reserved. (P&#305~nar'dan nefis ayran.) <p>Ingredients (Icindekiler): Pasteurized Milk, Pectin, Salt, Active Culture. (Pastorize Sut, Pektin, Tuz, Active Kultur.) <p>Info(Bilgi): Ayran has been one of the most popular drinks of the Turks since the discovery of Yogurt among the Turkish tribes in Central Asia. It is simply made by diluting yogurt with water. Some salt is added to taste. It not only accompanies any meal but is drunk as a refreshing drink by itself. <p>Nutirition Facts per Serving (Besin Ogeleri): N/A<p>Weight (Agirlik): 1.06 lbs. 2086;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Ottoman Empire-Suraiya Faroqhi;Author (Yazar): Suraiya Faroqhi<p>Type (Konu): History, Research. (Tarih, Arast&#305~rma) <p>ISBN: 1850437157 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): The Ottoman Empire and the World Around It<p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 290<p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#287~i): 15.5 x 23.5 cm, 2.hamur<p>Publisher (Matbaa): I.B. Tauris <p>Publishing Date (Bas&#305~m Tarihi): Nov. (Kasim) 2004<p>Description (Aciklamalar): In Islamic law the world was made up of the House of Islam and the House of War with the Ottoman Sultan - the perceived successor to the Caliphs - supreme ruler of the Islamic world. However, Suraiya Faroqhi demonstrates that there was no iron curtain between the Ottoman and other worlds but rather a long-established network of diplomatic, financial, cultural and religious connections. These extended to the empires of Asia and the modern states of Europe. Faroqhi's book is based on a huge study of original and early modern sources, including diplomatic records, travel and geographical writing, as well as personal accounts. Its breadth and originality will make it essential reading for historians of Europe and the Middle East.  <p>© All rights reserved. (Her hakk&#305~ sakl&#305~d&#305~r.) <p>Delivery (Teslim): Ships in 48 hours, delivered within 10 business days. When war is declared and the outside world intrudes, the twin scourges of religion and nationalism lead to forced marches and massacres, and the peaceful fabric of life is destroyed. Philothei, a Christian girl of legendary beauty, and Ibrahim the Goatherd who has courted her since infancy are but two of the many casualties. With the end of a community that once transcended religious differences, their great love seems destined to end in tragedy and madness... <p>© All rights reserved. 2187;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Olives, Anchovies, and Capers - Georgeanne Brennan;Author (Yazar): Georgeanne Brennan <p>Type (Konu): Cookbooks (Yemek Kitaplari) <p>ISBN: 0811824942 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Olives, Anchovies, and Capers -The Secret Ingredients of the Mediterranean Table <p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 132 (32 Color photos) <p>Translator (Çevirmen): N/A <p>Specialty (Özell&#286~i): 6 x 8 inches, Hardcover<p>Publisher (Matbaa): Chronicle Books <p>Publishing Date (Basim Tarihi): May (May&#305~s) 2001 <p>Description (Aciklamalar): No one knows just what makes the Mediterranean shores so white, the sun so golden, or the sea so blue. But thanks to award-winning author Georgeanne Brennan, we now know what makes the cuisine so delicious. Olives, anchovies, and capers are the secret ingredients behind the magical flavors of the Mediterranean. Toss a few tangy olives and capers, or a savory anchovy or two into these over 50 dazzling recipes and instantly capture the fresh, sun-drenched flavors of Italy, France, Greece, Tunisia, and Morocco. Enhanced by vibrant color photography, Brennan reveals the basic techniques for salting, brining, curing, and seasoning these delicacies and also explores their history and common uses. Bring the Mediterranean home with these simple, flavorful accents and add intensity and depth--with minimum effort--to any dish. <p>Georgeanne Brennan is a James Beard Award-winning author of numerous cooking and garden books. She lives in Northern California and France.<p>Leigh Beisch Leigh Beisch is a San Franciscobased photographer. Her work has appeared in many national fashion, lifestyle, and health magazines, as well as in Chronicle Books' Skewer It! and Cooking for the Week. <p>© All rights reserved. "Modern Greek offers 170 recipes for everything from meze to luscious pastry desserts. 2213;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): A Fistful of Lentils-Jennifer Felicia Abadi;Author (Yazar): Jennifer Felicia Abadi <p>Type (Konu): Cookbooks (Yemek Kitaplari) <p>ISBN: 1558322183 <p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): A Fistful of Lentils: Syrian-Jewish Recipes from Grandma Fritzie's Kitchen  <p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 352 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): NA <p>Specialty (Özell&#287~i): 7.61 x 1.34 x 9.43 inches <p>Publisher (Matbaa): The Harvard Comman Press<p>Publishing Date (Bas&#305~m Tarihi): Mar.(March) 2002 <p>Description (Aç&#305~klamalar):  When Jennifer Abadi was a child, her mother often pulled down a well-worn homemade black recipe binder from her kitchen shelf and created sumptuous Syrian feasts. As an adult, Jennifer pulled down that same binder to make her own delicious meals. Mindful of the importance of tradition and the ease with which old-world knowledge vanishes, Jennifer embarked on a labor of love with her grandmother to record all of her family's rich, mouthwatering Syrian dishes.The result is A Fistful of Lentils, an intimate culinary food album featuring 125 Syrian-Jewish recipes, warm family anecdotes, and little-known stories of Syrian-Jewish culture.<p>Syrian-Jewish cooking comes from the Sephardic (Spanish) and Mizrahic (Arabic) traditions rather than from the Ashkenazic (Eastern European) tradition. The lavish food features meats simmered with cumin, or allspice, or cinnamon~ savory vegetables stuffed or roasted~ sweet and sour sauces~ lemony dressings~ and rich sugar-dusted pastries drenched in rosewater syrup or sprinkled with almonds. It all adds up to the best-kept secret in Middle Eastern cuisine.<p>Endorsement from Steven Raichlen: "A vibrant, living cookbook, chock full of exciting recipes from one of the lesser-known, but most remarkable, Jewish gastronomic subcultures."<p>© All rights reserved. 2215;Books-English (Kitaplar-Ingilizce): Mediterranean Vegetables-Clifford A. Wright;Author (Yazar): Clifford A. Wright<p>Type (Konu): Cookbooks (Yemek Kitaplari) <p>ISBN: 1558321969<p>Title (Ba&#351~l&#305~k): Mediterranean Vegetables: A Cook's ABC of Vegetables and Their Preparation in Spain, France, Italy, Greece, Turkey, the Middle East, and North Africa, with More than 200 Authentic Recipies for the Home Cook<p>Original Title (Orjinal Ad&#305~): N/A <p>Number of Pages (Sayfa Say&#305~s&#305~): 388 <p>Translator (Çevirmen): NA <p>Specialty (Özell&#287~i): 7.6 x 1.41 x 9.42 inches <p>Publisher (Matbaa): The Harvard Common Press <p>Publishing Date (Bas&#305~m Tarihi): Sept.(Eylul) 2001<p>Description (Aç&#305~klamalar):  The countries that border the Mediterranean are exotic, alluring, and diverse, and so is the multitude of Mediterranean vegetable preparations. To open up this world to the American kitchen, Clifford A. Wright presents an original and comprehensive A-to-Z culinary reference. Eminently accessible and thoroughly useful, Mediterranean Vegetables includes more than 200 vegetables that are traditionally prepared in Mediterranean cookery. Each entry describes a vegetable~ explains its origins, culinary history, how to grow it, and where to get it~ and provides recipes. Never before has one book collected such a wealth of information in one place. The vegetables include those used by home cooks every day, as well as those that are readily available but cooks often don't know how to prepare. The recipes create delicious Mediterranean dishes that reflect the vegetables' versatility: from Italy Artichoke Hearts in Citrus Sauce~ from Spain Cabbage with Chestnuts~ from Lebanon Fried Eggplant with Yogurt~ from France Etouffee of White Beans~ from Syria Zucchini with Bread and Pomegranates, and more. <p>© All rights reserved.
